0.title: Saddened by the way Delhi bungalow was vacated: Chirag Paswan
0.article_body: LJP leader Chirag Paswan said he was saddened by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. "I never said that I want 12, Janpath forever. My family respects the law," Chirag Paswan said. "We were ready to vacate the house but why were we humiliated like this?" Paswan added.

1.title: Pak's Punjab Assembly adjourned without voting to elect new CM
1.article_body: A session of Pakistan's Punjab Assembly was adjourned till April 6 on Sunday without voting to elect the new Chief Minister. PML-Q's Chaudhry Parvez Elahi, one of the contenders for the CM's post, claimed the session was adjourned following an "attack" by the opposition lawmakers on MPAs of the ruling party. This comes amid a political crisis in Pakistan.

2.title: Shanghai asks 26 mn citizens to self-test for COVID as China sees highest cases in 2 yrs
2.article_body: Shanghai has ordered its 26 million residents to undergo two more rounds of tests for COVID-19. Residents should self-test on Sunday using antigen kits and report any positive results, while a nucleic acid test would be conducted on Monday. China on Sunday reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave in February 2020.

3.title: Vicky remembers Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his birth anniversary
3.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to his Instagram Stories on Sunday to remember Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his 108th birth anniversary. He shared a picture of the Field Marshal, who's popularly known as 'Sam Bahadur'. "Remembering Sam Bahadur," he wrote, with some folded hands emojis. Vicky will play Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in an upcoming biopic, titled 'Sam Bahadur'.

4.title: Economic jihad by K'taka CM will ensure we don't get jobs: Cong MLA
4.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said "economic jihad" by CM Basavaraj Bommai's party "will ensure that we neither get investments [nor] jobs". This comes after Bengaluru-based Khatabook Founder Ravish Naresh said the city's HSR/Koramangala area has bad roads and poor quality water supply. Telangana Minister KTR Rao later replied to Naresh's tweet and asked him to move to Hyderabad.

5.title: Gauri Khan share pics with Farah, says 'Never a dull moment with her'
5.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife, interior designer Gauri Khan shared few pictures with choreographer-director Farah Khan on Instagram. One of the pictures, showed Farah holding Gauri from behind. Praising Farah, Gauri captioned the post, "Never a dull moment hanging with Farah...Love her cinema and her humour." According to reports, Farah and Gauri have collaborated for a new show.

6.title: It was the biggest blockbuster of 1992: Anil celebrates 30 yrs of 'Beta'
6.article_body: Anil Kapoor on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 30th anniversary of his film 'Beta'. He shared a series of photos, where he and Madhuri Dixit were seen receiving an award for the movie. "It was a great feeling for us as actors when our film was the biggest blockbuster of...1992 and received so much love," Anil wrote.

7.title: Malaika returns to home from hospital after suffering injuries in car accident
7.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has returned to her Mumbai home after suffering injuries in a car accident on the Mumbai-Pune highway on Saturday. The actress was discharged from the hospital on Sunday morning. "The actress suffered minor injuries on her forehead; CT scan has turned out fine & she is currently okay," Apollo Hospital had said on Saturday night.

8.title: Man who said he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train jailed for 1 year
8.article_body: A man from Goa was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment after being found guilty of kissing a woman on her cheek on a Mumbai local train in 2015. The man claimed his lips inadvertently touched her cheek after he was pushed by a commuter and fell on her. The court rejected his defence, saying women are "perceptive" about such things.

9.title: Those involved in rioting won't be spared: Rajasthan CM on Karauli incident
9.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has assured strict action against those responsible for communal clashes that broke out in Karauli on Saturday. "Those involved in inciting riots will not be spared and stringent action will be taken against them. Rule of law will be followed in the state," Gehlot added. Section 144 was imposed in the area following the incident.

10.title: Left Kashmir due to extremism, will go back as Bharat Bhakt: RSS chief
10.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that Kashmiri Pandits left the valley due to extremism. "But when we'll return now...we'll go back as Hindus & 'Bharat Bhakt' with...an assurance of our security and livelihood. We'll live in way...that nobody will dare to displace us," he said, adding, "Kashmiri Pandits [are] bearing brunt of getting displaced from...home in...own country for...last 3-4 decades."

11.title: SDM booked after clerk beaten to death in UP’s Pratapgarh
11.article_body: The sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) of Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh, Gyanendra Vikram Singh, has been booked in connection with the death of a tehsil clerk. The family of the 57-year-old victim, Sunil Kumar Sharma, has alleged that he died after being severely beaten up by Singh and a few others. The case was registered against the SDM after the government employees protested.

12.title: Late rapper Tupac's love letters to girl named Cosima sold at auction for over $50,000
12.article_body: Late rapper Tupac Shakur's love letters to a girl named Cosima have been sold at an auction for over $50,000. Tupac and Cosima had met in October 1988, when the rapper was 17 years old. All of the letters, written in 1988-1999 were signed at the end with "Thinking of U! Eternally your friend, Tupac A Shakur".

13.title: Ensure animals are stunned before slaughtering them in B'luru: K'taka govt
13.article_body: The Karnataka Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services Department has asked the Bengaluru civic body to ensure animals are mandatorily stunned before they are slaughtered for meat. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has also been asked to check the stunning facility while issuing licences for slaughterhouses and chicken shops. The directions come amid the 'halal' meat controversy.

14.title: I'm gay, thought I'd never ever come out: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael
14.article_body: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael has come out in his comedy special 'Rothaniel', saying, "I had a secret...I kept from my...family...friends... Professionally, personally. And that secret is that I'm gay." Jerrod further said he rebelled against it his whole life and thought he'd "never ever come out". "At many points I thought I'd rather die than...actually say it to people," he added.

15.title: Varun Sood, Divya Agarwal spotted for the first time post breakup, pics surface
15.article_body: Divya Agarwal and Varun Sood were spotted in the city together for the first time post their breakup. The former couple was seen together at a footwear sale event which also had a live DJ set at night. Several pictures surfaced online, where Varun is seen protecting Divya from the crowd as they made their way to the event.

16.title: Bowling partners make things easy for me: GT pacer Lockie Ferguson
16.article_body: After picking up four wickets against Delhi Capitals on Saturday, Gujarat Titans pacer Lockie Ferguson said that his "bowling partners make things very easy" for him. "It's great (to have a potent bowling unit) and helps to spread calmness in the group. The pressure was coming from both ends with the ball and it worked for us," Ferguson said.

17.title: Will hold 5-pronged protest against Centre over paddy procurement: TRS Min
17.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi Minister KT Rama Rao has said that his party is going to hold a five-pronged protest against the BJP-led Centre across Telangana over the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state. Different forms of protests including the blocking of national highways will take place on April 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11, Rao said.

18.title: Getting married didn't matter for me; Siddharth changed my perspective: Vidya
18.article_body: Vidya Balan has revealed that earlier she felt being in a live-in relationship or marriage didn't matter.  She added that now she appreciates marriage because of her husband Siddharth Roy Kapur and he changed her perspective. "I feel blessed to have him as my partner. He accepts me the way I'm, on my good days and bad days," Vidya said.

19.title: Over 90% people satisfied with Mohalla clinics: Delhi govt survey
19.article_body: Around 93% of the patients that visit the Aam Aadmi Mohalla clinics in Delhi are satisfied with its services, according to a Delhi government survey. A patient spends an average of 9.92 minutes to meet the doctor and 8.35 minutes to collect medicines at the clinic. Around 116 patient visits were recorded per Mohalla clinic per day in 2021.

20.title: Maharashtra Police make monkey drink water from bottle, video surfaces
20.article_body: Maharashtra Police made a monkey drink water from a bottle. The video of the incident went viral on social media. "Salute to Maharashtra Police for the kindness and compassion towards voiceless babies," an Instagram user wrote while sharing the video. Several users dropped hearts in the comments section of the video.

21.title: Rachakonda Police share QR code for recruitment training enrolment
21.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police have shared a QR code on Twitter for aspirants seeking pre-recruitment training to enrol in police. Eligible aspirants residing within Rachakonda limits, who wish to apply for Telangana Police jobs, including roles of sub-inspector and police constable, can scan code and apply for free integrated coaching, police said. The last date to apply is April 5.

22.title: Sri Lankan Navy apprehends 12 Indian fishermen, impounds boat near Delft island
22.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy on Sunday apprehended 12 Indian fishermen and impounded one boat for allegedly fishing near Delft island. The fishermen had gone out to sea in 530 mechanised boats on Saturday. This comes amid an economic crisis in the neighbouring country, due to which the Sri Lankan Navy has increased patrolling activities to avoid its nationals from escaping.

23.title: Shooting next film in Iran, will take mom along: John Abraham
23.article_body: Actor John Abraham has stated that he'll be shooting his next film 'Tehran' in Iran, adding he would probably be the first Indian actor to shoot there. "My mom has got 21 cousins in Iran and I want to take her along," he said. John added that 'Tehran' is in the geopolitical space of 'Madras Cafe', 'Batla House' and 'Parmanu'.

24.title: Nepal becomes 4th country to launch India's e-payment system RuPay
24.article_body: Nepal on Saturday became the fourth country in the world to operationalise India's e-payment system RuPay. The three other countries that have the RuPay card are Bhutan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates. The Indian External Affairs Ministry said the launch of the card in Nepal would open new vistas for cooperation in financial connectivity and further strengthen people-to-people linkages.

25.title: Delhi-Meerut rail corridor to be designed to handle medical emergencies
25.article_body: The stations and train coaches of the rapid rail corridor between Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut will be designed to handle health emergencies. "Lifts will be big enough to accommodate stretchers, wheelchairs and people, like in hospitals...in rapid rail any person can reach Delhi-NCR's big hospitals...in 55 minutes without traffic...or extra charges usually spent on ambulances," an official said.

26.title: Newlyweds, friend drown in river while clicking selfies in Maha
26.article_body: A newly married couple and their friend drowned as they were allegedly clicking selfies in a village in Maharashtra's Beed, police said on Sunday. "The trio drowned while trying to save each other," an official said. The three deceased's bodies had been fished out of the river a day earlier, the official added. Three accidental death reports have been filed.

27.title: After Raj's remark, Hanuman Chalisa played on Mumbai loudspeakers
27.article_body: A day after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers in mosques, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Mumbai's Ghatkopar. "I am warning now...Remove loudspeakers or else will put loudspeakers in front of the mosque and play Hanuman Chalisa," Thackeray had said.

28.title: Talk of stagflation in India is 'overhyped': NITI Aayog VC
28.article_body: India is on the cusp of a major economic recovery and talks of possible stagflation are "overhyped", said NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar. "I am sure that the RBI is well in control of [inflation] and will take necessary steps if and when required," Kumar said. Despite the Russia-Ukraine war, "India will remain the fastest growing economy", he added.

29.title: Pune Police busts an IPL betting racket, seize ₹27 lakh, 8 phones
29.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested three people after busting an IPL betting racket at Kalewadi on Saturday night. The police seized ₹27 lakh and eight cell phones from the accused, who were betting on the match between Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Titans, which was being played at the MCA stadium in Pune.

30.title: Drug cultivation banned in world's biggest opium producer Afghanistan by Taliban
30.article_body: The Taliban has banned the cultivation of narcotics in Afghanistan, the world's biggest opium producer. The authorities said that if anyone violated the decree, the crop will be destroyed immediately and the violator will be treated according to Sharia law. Apart from this, the production, use or transportation of other narcotics has also been banned.

31.title: My wedding should be drama-free; there's enough drama in my work life: Taapsee
31.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said that she wants a "single-day wedding affair" in tasteful nude and other subtle colours. She added, "It needs to be basic and drama-free because there's enough drama in my professional life, and I don't want it to trickle down into my personal life." Taapsee further said that she doesn't want any late night rites at her wedding.

32.title: Not bowling Moeen in 19th over was a mistake: Kaif on CSK's loss vs LSG
32.article_body: Following CSK's six-wicket loss against LSG in IPL 2022, Mohammad Kaif said not giving 19th over to Moeen Ali was a mistake, adding it wasn't skipper Ravindra Jadeja's decision. "He [Jadeja] is still learning. Even now, decisions are taken by MS Dhoni," he added. With 34 runs needed off last 12 balls, Shivam Dube conceded 25 runs in 19th over.

33.title: Good thing that Hardik took the new ball with Shami vs DC: Jaffer
33.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer said he was "very impressed" with Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya's bowling during the match against Delhi Capitals in the IPL 2022. "The pace was up...he was touching 140 [kmph]...[it was a] good thing...he took the new ball with (Mohammad) Shami," Jaffer added. Hardik conceded 22 runs in his bowling spell and scalped one wicket.

34.title: Delhi Capitals need to improve batting in powerplay: Ricky Ponting
34.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting said his team needs to improve the batting performance during the powerplay. "If you are losing three wickets in the powerplay, it's really hard to win games from there...That's certainly one area that we got to get better at, getting through that powerplay," he added. Gujarat Titans defeated Delhi Capitals by 14 runs.

35.title: Ambulance with patient runs out of fuel in UP, dragged to fuel station
35.article_body: An ambulance that was on its way with a patient to Uttar Pradesh's Meerut allegedly ran out of fuel mid-way. A tractor then dragged the ambulance to the nearest fuel station. Chief Medical Officer of Meerut Dr Akhilesh Mohan said that the ambulance was not from Meerut and was coming from Bijnor when the incident took place.

36.title: MP CM asks hotel owners in Ujjain to use Hindi signboards instead of English
36.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has asked hotel owners in Ujjain, an ancient city, to use Hindi signboards instead of English. "Our academic development will happen only with the growth of our language," he said. Chouhan added that the practice of begging on Ujjain's streets should be stopped and a mass feast should be held regularly for the poor.

37.title: Grammys 2022 to have special segment dedicated to Ukraine
37.article_body: The 64th Grammy Awards will have a special segment dedicated to Ukraine's ongoing crisis amid the war with Russia. "We're heartbroken by...situation in Ukraine, yet still moved by the resilient spirit on display there every day," Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr said, adding, "We hope the segment inspires our audience to get involved to support critical humanitarian efforts."

38.title: Ex-UN prosecutor calls for global arrest warrant against Putin
38.article_body: A former prosecutor of UN war crimes tribunals, Carla Del Ponte, has called for a global arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine. "Putin is a war criminal," she said. "These dead people have loved ones who don't even know what's become of them. That is unacceptable," she said of mass graves in Ukraine.

39.title: Law of land prevails in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut on Raj Thackeray’s remark
39.article_body: The law of the land prevails in Maharashtra and the state Home Minister will do everything as per the law, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Sunday. His statement came in reaction to MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques. "People thought it (Raj Thackeray's event) was BJP's event," Raut added.

40.title: Indore zoo arranges ACs, water coolers for animals amid rising temperatures
40.article_body: In view of the rising temperatures, arrangements have been made for coolers, ACs and sprinklers at Indore’s Kamla Nehru Zoological Garden to provide respite to animals from the heat. "The water bodies and coolers have been installed for tiger, lion, leopard…Piped water is also being sprayed," Zoo in-charge, Dr Uttam Yadav, said.

41.title: US makes 40 miles per gallon mileage must for new vehicles by 2026
41.article_body: By 2026, all new vehicles sold in the US must deliver a mileage of at least 49 miles per gallon, the government has ordered. Currently, the minimum mileage required for vehicles stands at 28 mpg. The administration said the new rules are the strongest to date, which will save over 220 billion gallons of gasoline over the lives of vehicles.

42.title: Saisha Shinde returns to 'Lock Upp' after apology to Kangana
42.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who was eliminated from reality show 'Lock Upp' following an argument with host Kangana Ranaut, has returned to the show. A promo shows her reentering the jail while dancing to the song 'Bole Chudiyan Bole Kangana'. This comes after Saisha took to Instagram to apologise to Kangana saying she just wanted to be a version of her.

43.title: Russian airstrikes hit 'critical infrastructure' near Odessa port
43.article_body: The Russian military on Sunday carried out strikes on "critical infrastructure" near Ukraine's Odessa. An oil processing plant and fuel depots around the strategic Black Sea port were targeted in the attack. A Russian Defense Ministry spokesman said Russian ships and aircraft fired missiles on Sunday to strike the facilities that were used to provide fuel to Ukrainian troops.

44.title: Nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy: Jaffer on Starc cheering for her
44.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share picture of Mitchell Starc cheering for his wife and fellow cricketer Alyssa Healy in Australia's 2022 Women's World Cup final against England. Starc was seen giving Healy a standing ovation after she reached the three-figure mark. "Pretty nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy," wrote Jaffer.

45.title: 'Adipurush' will depict 'Parakrama' side of Lord Ram: Director Om Raut
45.article_body: Director Om Raut spoke about his upcoming film 'Adipurush',  an adaptation of 'Ramayana', and said, "Ramayana has always had a strong influence since ages. I'm depicting the 'Parakrama' (splendour and magnificence) side of Ram." He added that shooting with Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan has been a great experience. 'Adipurush' will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif as Ravan.

46.title: Ex-Bengaluru Police chief Bhaskar Rao quits, likely to join AAP
46.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao's resignation has been accepted by the  Karnataka government. Rao, who was presently serving as the Additional Director General of Police, is likely to join the AAP on Monday. The 1990-batch IPS officer had cited personal reasons for the resignation. He was the city police chief between 2019 and 2020.

47.title: WHO suspends UN supply of Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine
47.article_body: The WHO has suspended the supply through United Nations agencies of Covaxin, the COVID-19 vaccine produced by India's Bharat Biotech. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the suspension is to allow the manufacturer to upgrade facilities and address deficiencies found in an inspection. "The WHO said the vaccine is effective and no safety concerns exist," the reports added.

48.title: Putin using body double to avoid being assassinated amid Ukraine war: Report
48.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is reportedly using a body double to foil any assassination attempts amid the ongoing invasion of Ukraine. As per a report, his body double has also been trained to walk in the same manner as Putin and is also present at Kremlin meetings. He is also said to be living in the same Presidential complex.

49.title: I like Tilak Varma's temperament, he isn't scared of big names: Shastri
49.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has praised MI's 19-year-old batter Tilak Varma after he scored 61 off 33 balls against RR in their match on Saturday. "I like Tilak's temperament very much. He wasn't scared of the big names...He used the pace really well too. This is a good omen for MI," stated Shastri. Tilak had scored 22(15) against DC.

50.title: Demi Lovato gets a tattoo to show support for Ukrainian refugees
50.article_body: Singer Demi Lovato has got a new tattoo to show her support for refugees around the world, including those fleeing Ukraine. The tattoo on her arm says "choose love", which is also the name of a non-profit organisation that supports refugees. Tattoo artist Gusak, whose home country is Ukraine, made the tattoo for Lovato.

51.title: Lunch box came with salad, he'd say 'What's this, where's food?': Juhi on Rishi
51.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla recalled that during 'Luck By Chance', late actor Rishi Kapoor's lunch box came with sprouts and salads. "He said, 'What is this, where is my food?'" Juhi said, adding, "That was Chintuji." Meanwhile, 'Sharmaji Namkeen' producer Ritesh Sidhwani said that Kapoor looked forward to his lunch breaks and his night meals.

52.title: 280 people buried in mass grave in Ukraine's Bucha: Mayor
52.article_body: Mayor of Ukraine's Bucha has said that about 280 people have been buried in a mass grave after Russian troops retreated. According to a Reuters report, the mayor added that "a mass grave at one church...was still open, with hands and feet poking through red clay heaped on top". Earlier, a video showing bodies on Bucha's streets had surfaced online.

53.title: Herd of elephants looking for 'mahua' liquor destroys houses in Chhattisgarh
53.article_body: A herd of more than a dozen elephants on Saturday allegedly destroyed several houses in Chhattisgarh's Surguja. "As a measure of safety, we have been leaving our homes every evening and returning in the morning," a local resident said. "The elephants are attracted to 'mahua' [liquor] stored in the houses, for which they have destroyed them," Surguja DFO said.

54.title: Trying to get back my 'Force' body; want to break through walls: John
54.article_body: John Abraham said he's trying to get back to his 'Force' body, where he can just break through the walls. When asked about 'Force 3', John said, "Force is the most untapped action franchise right now. I want to make 'Force' into a tentpole summer blockbuster." "It has the potential of being one of the biggest action franchises," he added.

55.title: Dravid will do a remarkable job as India head coach: Ganguly
55.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said Rahul Dravid will do a remarkable job as India head coach as he's honest. "He's as meticulous...professional as he was during his playing days," he added. Ganguly further said that Dravid will make mistakes as everybody does but he can become successful by doing right things. Dravid was appointed as head coach in November 2021.

56.title: Kalyan-Kasara train services hit after rail fracture; restored later
56.article_body: Local train services on the Kalyan-Kasara route of the Central Railway in Thane were affected for around an hour on Sunday morning due to a rail fracture. The issue was reported at 10.40 am between Umbermali and Kasara. It was resolved by 11.30 am and the local train services resumed later.

57.title: 43 'chulhas' in kitchen of Puri's Jagannath Temple found vandalised
57.article_body: At least 43 'chulhas' (stoves) in the kitchen of Puri's Jagannath Temple were found vandalised on Sunday, officials said. "We are not sure who did it, but the servitors who are responsible would face disciplinary action," a temple official said. Officials said around six to eight servitors who are engaged in the cooking rituals were possibly involved in the incident.

58.title: IPL betting racket busted in Noida, 6 arrested
58.article_body: The police on Saturday busted an IPL betting racket operating in Noida, arresting six people in the process, according to officials. The police seized ₹1.64 lakh in cash, 12 cellphones, 20 bank passbooks and two vehicles from the suspects. Nearly 50 to 60 people used to bet on the matches daily, a senior official said.

59.title: Pak elections to be held in 90 days after no-trust motion against Imran Khan rejected
59.article_body: Pakistan's Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Farrukh Habib said that new elections will be held in 90 days. This comes after PM Imran Khan called for fresh elections and for the Assemblies to be dissolved after the no-trust motion against him was rejected. Habib added that PM Khan will continue his duties under Article 224 of the Constitution.

60.title: Women don't ask for pics: Yashpal on the drawback of playing villain on screen
60.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma invited Bollywood villains, Ashish Vidyarthi, Mukesh Rishi, Yashpal Sharma and Abhimanyu Singh to his upcoming episode of 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. During a conversation, Kapil asked Yashpal if he faced any drawbacks of playing a villain on-screen. Yashpal jokingly replied, "The setback is...girls don't come close to me while clicking photos. They stand at a distance."

61.title: Workers’ union asks Hyderabad airport to set up shelter for drivers
61.article_body: Telangana Gig and Platforms Workers Union (TGPWU) has requested the Hyderabad airport authority to set up a shelter for taxi drivers amid soaring temperatures. The TGPWU also appealed for a drinking water facility and subsidised canteen facilities for drivers. "The drivers who have to wait long hours for passengers...are risking their lives for making a living," TGPWU said.

62.title: COVID-19 boosters are essential, we shouldn't delay: Shaw to Health Minister
62.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Sunday and said that announcing booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines can help prevent the wastage of unused stocks. "All healthcare institutions are worried about unused stocks of vaccines that will expire soon," she said, adding that COVID-19 "boosters are essential and we should not delay".

63.title: Windshield of plane with 198 passengers cracks mid-flight in US, pic surfaces
63.article_body: A Delta Airlines flight made an emergency landing in US' Denver after its cockpit window "spontaneously" cracked while it was around 30,000 feet in the air. One of the 198 passengers on board the flight shared a picture of the cracked windshield, saying, "Fortunately, we landed safely and are about to get back in air. We're grateful for safe flights."

64.title: Haven't heard anything about it: Randhir Kapoor on reports of Ranbir & Alia's wedding
64.article_body: Amid media reports of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt’s wedding in April, Ranbir's uncle Randhir Kapoor remarked that he hasn't heard anything about it. He said, "If such a big wedding was happening at our house, somebody would have surely called me up and informed me." Meanwhile, celebrity mehandi artist Veena Nagda also said she hasn’t been contacted as yet.

65.title: I expect Jadeja to strategise better, we want to see what he can do: Ojha
65.article_body: Former India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said he expects CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja to strategise better in their upcoming games in the IPL season. "It was the same team that won last year...They'll have to come up with different thinking...we want to see what Jadeja can do as captain," he added. CSK have lost their first two games this season.

66.title: Who are we to condemn? Denzel Washington on Will slapping Chris
66.article_body: Actor Denzel Washington has reacted to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, saying, "Who are we to condemn?" He further said, "I don't know all the ins and outs of the situation but I know the only solution was prayer." Denzel was seen consoling Will after the incident at the ceremony and also spoke to his publicist.

67.title: Reports say Kanye West is 'going away to get help', rapper's team denies
67.article_body: After reports said rapper Kanye West will "go away somewhere to get help", the rapper's team has denied it. West's rep said, "Most [headlines] are being fed to media by...sources close to the Kardashians...which have been...creating false narrative...that not only is untrue...but further compromises his goal of creating...healthy environment for...children he shares...with Kim."

68.title: Video shows Mumbai Police's Khaki Studio performing at 'Sunday Streets'
68.article_body: A video shows the Khaki Studio of the Mumbai Police giving a live performance during the 'Sunday Streets' event on Mumbai roads. The initiative, which was launched last Sunday, is being organised in nine locations from today. Last Sunday saw a huge gathering of people as they engaged in activities like cycling, yoga and running.

69.title: Shein planning to raise funds at a valuation of $100 billion: Report
69.article_body: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is planning to raise funds at a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported on Sunday. The company is in talks with potential investors to raise about $1 billion, the report said. Backed by Sequoia Capital China, IDG Capital and Tiger Global, Shein denied plans to launch an initial public offering (IPO) last month.

70.title: Raj stays underground for 3-4 months, lacks consistency: Pawar
70.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray alleged that the NCP plays the caste card to "divide" people, the latter party's chief Sharad Pawar said that Thackeray should have "studied" NCP's history before making the remarks. Thackeray "stays underground for three to four months and suddenly surfaces to give a lecture" and never has a consistent stand on any issue, he added.

71.title: Greece minister leads humanitarian aid mission to Ukraine's Odessa
71.article_body: Greek Foreign Minister Nikos Dendias will land in Ukraine's Odessa on Sunday to lead a humanitarian aid mission in the city amid Russia's ongoing invasion of the country. Dendias will carry humanitarian aid which will be handed to the city's municipal authorities. The purpose of Dendias' visit is to also reopen Greece's consulate in the city, its foreign ministry said.

72.title: 68 undertrials in jails for petty crimes released after mega camp in Ludhiana
72.article_body: A mega camp court was organised by the District Legal Services Authority, Ludhiana on Saturday. During the camp, around 68 undertrials, who had been booked and jailed for petty offences, were released by officials. During the camp, the cases of undertrials in custody for petty offences, who were willing to confess to their crimes and plead guilty, were taken up.

73.title: 5 Bajrang Dal workers held for attacking K'taka halal meat seller
73.article_body: Five Bajrang Dal workers have been arrested in Karnataka's Shivamogga after they allegedly attacked a Muslim halal meat seller. This comes amid a campaign by Hindu right-wings to boycott halal products. The group, including the accused, had gone to the seller's shop on Wednesday and asked for non-halal meat. The group reportedly attacked after seller's relative asked them to leave.

74.title: PBKS skipper Mayank hasn't scored a lot so far in IPL 2022: Aakash
74.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra, speaking about Punjab Kings captain Mayank Agarwal, opined that he has not scored many runs in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Mayank is the captain and is a solid player...He hasn't scored a lot so far, but you expect runs from him," Aakash stated. In IPL 2022, Mayank has scored 33 runs in two matches.

75.title: Punjab should first give Hindi-speaking areas to Haryana: Khattar
75.article_body: After the Punjab Assembly sought the transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar asked the newly-formed AAP government to first hand over the Hindi-speaking areas to his state. "Rajiv-Longowal Accord was signed 35-36 years ago, as per which [Chandigarh] is the capital of both Haryana and Punjab," said Khattar.

76.title: 3-metre ring, other objects found in Maha after mysterious lights in sky, pics surface
76.article_body: A three-metre ring and other objects were found in Maharashtra after mysterious lights were spotted in sky on Saturday night. Experts speculate that the object seen falling from the sky is a satellite that got destroyed after coming into contact with the earth's atmosphere. Earlier, people speculated it could be a meteor shower. Police are working to ascertain the details.

77.title: Netflix halts development of Will Smith's film over Oscars slap: Report
77.article_body: Netflix has halted the production of Will Smith's action-thriller movie, 'Fast and Loose', following the Oscars incident with Chris Rock, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Smith had slapped the Oscars presenter and comedian Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett's condition during the award ceremony. Smith later apologised to Chris Rock and resigned from the Oscars Academy.

78.title: Peace? I hate the word: World's richest person Elon Musk
78.article_body: The world's richest person, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Peace. Peace? I hate the word. Those who do care about peace (myself aspirationally included) don't need to hear it...And those who don't care about peace? Well..." In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "They wrote PEACE on the wall at Berghain! I refused (to) enter." Berghain is a nightclub in Berlin.

79.title: Govt violated Constitution, will not leave Parliament: Pak Opposition on no-trust motion
79.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has said Pakistan government has violated Constitution by not allowing voting on no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. He said, "The united opposition is not leaving Parliament. Our lawyers are on their way to Supreme Court." He added, "We call on all institutions to protect, uphold, defend and implement the Constitution of Pakistan."

80.title: There won't be any talks of terrorists in madrasas: UP Minister
80.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Dharam Pal Singh said that the students will be given education in madrasas based on new National Education Policy. "Nationalism will be taught to students in madrasas of the state. There will be no talks of terrorists," he added. Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai's political secretary had earlier said madrasas propagate instigation to innocent kids.

81.title: Saudi minister meets SRK, Salman, Saif and Akshay Kumar in Mumbai, shares pics
81.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Minister of Culture Bader bin Farhan Alsaud met Bollywood actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshay Kumar during his Mumbai visit. "Delighted to have engaged in insightful conversations on the beautiful world of films, exploring cross-cultural collaborations [with them]," he wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

82.title: Mizoram bans import of pigs, pork products amid African Swine Fever outbreak
82.article_body: The Mizoram government has banned the import of pigs and pork products until further orders after fresh African Swine Fever (ASF) cases were reported in the state, according to an official notification. The department has been directed to ensure safe disposal of pig carcasses. As many as 384 pig deaths were reported from across five districts of Mizoram, officials said.

83.title: Look at how Dhoni is batting, he's not finished, he's a finisher: Kaif
83.article_body: Ahead of CSK's match against PBKS, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif praised CSK batter MS Dhoni for his performance in their first two games in IPL 2022. "Dhoni is not finished, he's a finisher. People have said his time is over...this could be his last IPL, but look at how he has batted, remaining not-out in both innings," stated Kaif.

84.title: Very impressed with Hardik Pandya's captaincy: Jaffer
84.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer has said he was "very impressed" with Hardik Pandya's captaincy as GT defeated DC by 14 runs to win their second game in a row. "By the end of the 15th over, Hardik had four overs of their specialist bowlers...Although he had to manage one over, I think...he trusted his main bowlers," stated Jaffer.

85.title: Pak Prez dissolves National Assembly on PM Imran Khan's advice
85.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Sunday dissolved the country's National Assembly on the advice of Prime Minister Imran Khan to make way for fresh elections. "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections," said Khan. Earlier, the Assembly Deputy Speaker rejected the no-confidence motion against Khan.

86.title: US Prez mistakenly refers to Michelle Obama as Vice President, video viral
86.article_body: US President Joe Biden in his recent speech mistakenly referred to former First Lady Michelle Obama as the former Vice President. Biden while praising First Lady Jill Biden said, "And I’m deeply proud of the work she is doing as First Lady with Joining Forces initiative she started with Michelle Obama when she was Vice President and now carries on."

87.title: It shall pass: Shilpa as Badshah says 'you've faced difficulties with a smile'
87.article_body: Rapper Badshah praised actress Shilpa Shetty and said she manages to remain strong despite all odds. While speaking to Shilpa on her fitness show, 'Shape of You', Badshah said, "After all that you've gone through, you manage to put up...a smile on your face and you don't fake it." Replying to this, Shilpa said, "Nothing is permanent...This too shall pass."

88.title: 3 held in Bihar for cheating Vaishno Devi pilgrims with fake chopper tickets
88.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar's Khagaria by the Jammu police for allegedly cheating people by providing fake tickets for helicopter rides from Katra to Mata Vaishno Devi shrine atop the hill nearby, police said on Saturday. Meanwhile, the Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said it has not authorised any private travel agency for helicopter bookings for Katra-Sanjichhat-Katra.

89.title: Arjun Rampal, Purab to star in investigative thriller series 'London Files'
89.article_body: Actors Arjun Rampal and Purab Kohli will be seen in an investigative thriller series, 'London Files'. The six-episode series has been directed by Sachin Pathak, the filmmaker behind shows like 'Kathmandu Connection' and 'A Simple Murder'. In addition to Arjun and Purab, 'London Files' will also feature Sapna Pabbi, Medha Rana, Gopal Datt and Eva Jane Willis in key roles.

90.title: Disapprove of policemen taking anyone's phone: B'luru police chief
90.article_body: Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Saturday shared a news report stating that police officers were "forcing" locals in the city to hand over their phones to check WhatsApp and photos, saying, "We strongly disapprove of any such act." He urged people to share the details of such incidents. "Strict action shall be taken against such officers," he added.

91.title: Anti-Romeo squads back in UP; to be active near schools, colleges
91.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has activated the anti-Romeo squads again in a bid to provide safety to women. According to Additional Chief Secretary Navneet Sehgal, the fortnight-long drive will continue till April 15. "Anti-Romeo squads will be activated near schools and colleges," said Sehgal. "In the evening, police will undertake patrolling in busy markets and crowded places," he added.

92.title: Imran Khan's ex-wife calls him 'mini-Trump', asks Twitter to take action on his tweet
92.article_body: Ahead of the no-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday, his ex-wife Reham Khan termed him "mini Trump" on Twitter and urged the platform to take action against him. She wrote, "This mini Trump must be restrained from inciting violence." Khan had called his political opponents as "the traitors who sold out to foreign masters" in a tweet.

93.title: Australia defeat England to win Women's World Cup for the 7th time
93.article_body: Australia defeated England by 71 runs in the final in Christchurch to win 2022 Women's World Cup. With this, Australia have now won seven Women's ODI World Cups. Australia put up a total of 356/5, the highest total in a Women's World Cup final. Australia's Alyssa Healy recorded the highest individual score (170 runs) in a Women's World Cup final.

94.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan asks President to dissolve assemblies, hold fresh elections
94.article_body: After no-trust vote against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by the deputy speaker of the country's National Assembly, Imran said, "I have written to the President to dissolve the assemblies." He added, "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections."

95.title: Mumbai’s annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, reopens after 2 years
95.article_body: After the state government lifted all the COVID-19 related curbs this month, Mumbai's annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, is set to reopen after remaining closed for two consecutive years. "This week, I met all the stakeholders, requested for strict hygiene...All the concerned departments will fully cooperate," said local MLA Amin Patel. Notably, Mohammed Ali Road is the market's traditional spot.

96.title: Additional OSCs to open in districts with high crime rate against women: Smriti Irani
96.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani said the Centre is planning to open additional one-stop centres (OSCs) in those districts where the crime rate against women is high. "We request your (states’) support to open these 300 new centres," Irani added. Additionally, government is planning to set up such centres in at least 10 other countries to support women of Indian origin.

97.title: 4 thieves cut open ATM in Gurugram, escape with cash worth ₹13.28 lakh
97.article_body: Four unidentified thieves allegedly cut open an ATM of a private bank in Gurugram and stole cash worth ₹13.28 lakh. Police said preliminary investigation revealed that the accused used a gas cutter to cut open the machine and sprayed the CCTVs with black paint before escaping. "The kiosk shutter was lowered and no security guard was deployed," an inspector said.

98.title: K'taka man throws mother in river, says 'Wife wanted to get rid of her'
98.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly killed his 60-year-old mother by throwing her into the Bhima river in Karnataka. The accused, Bheemashankar Yalimeli, during investigation, stated his wife wanted to get rid of his mother as she was ill. He also added he was facing difficulty in arranging money for his mother's treatment and he and his wife often fought over it.

99.title: In a first, SDMC collects over ₹1,000 crore in property tax
99.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation collected ₹1,075 crore from 460,000 taxpayers this year. According to Radha Krishan, head of the SDMC's property tax department, the corporation has crossed the ₹1,000 crore mark for the first time while it collected ₹943 crore in 2020-21. Krishan added that ₹917 crore was raised as property transfer duty which is also an all-time high.

100.title: Pakistan's Punjab Governor fired ahead of no-trust vote against PM
100.article_body: The Governor of Pakistan's Punjab province, Chaudhry Mohammad Sarwar, was fired on Sunday ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan in the National Assembly. According to media reports, Omar Sarfraz Cheema has been appointed as the new Governor of the province. Sarwar was not following the government line, added reports.

101.title: No-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan rejected
101.article_body: The no-confidence motion against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by Pakistan National Assembly Deputy Speaker Qasim Khan Suri on Sunday. Suri declared the motion as unconstitutional, reported ANI. Though PM Khan is the third premier to face the no-confidence motion, no one in Pakistan's history has ever been ousted through such a motion.

102.title: Pak Opposition moves motion to remove National Assembly Speaker
102.article_body: A Pakistan's Opposition member on Sunday moved a motion seeking the removal of the National Assembly Speaker Asad Qaiser ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. Over 100 members of Opposition parties have reportedly signed the no-confidence motion against Qaiser. Notably, Section 144 has been imposed in Islamabad amid fears of violence.

103.title: 2 bodies found in Pune dam's backwaters after clothes seen nearby
103.article_body: The bodies of two men in their late 20s were fished out from the backwaters of Khadakwasla Dam, located on the outskirts of Pune, police said on Sunday. The incident came to light after locals informed guards about two pairs of shoes and clothes lying near the dam, while no human activity was seen inside the backwaters, an official said.

104.title: Nortje, Warner likely to play in DC's next game, says Ponting
104.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said it's likely that South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje and Australia batter David Warner will be available for their next game against LSG on April 7. "Nortje bowled 100% in the warm-ups...[and] I think Warner has arrived in Mumbai," stated Ponting. After winning their opening game against MI, DC lost to GT on Saturday.

105.title: I still need to gather courage to post a picture in a bikini: Mrunal
105.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur feels India hasn't normalised different body types. "We still think if you're going to a beach you've to have a perfect body," she added. "It's okay to be bloated...You...[don't] necessarily [need]...six-pack abs," she said. Mrunal said she still needs to gather the courage to post a picture in a bikini and be comfortable in her body type.

106.title: Actor Vikrant Massey gets Gulzar's juttis as birthday gift, shares pic
106.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey took to Instagram Stories to share that he received lyricist Gulzar's juttis as a birthday gift. He shared a picture of the juttis and a letter from Gulzar's daughter Meghna, who he had worked with in Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak'. "Dear Vikrant...This was long overdue...But I am glad I got it done today!" the letter by Meghna read.

107.title: Man who claimed he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train gets 1-yr jail term
107.article_body: A 37-year-old man was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment and a fine of ₹10,000 was imposed on him for forcibly kissing a woman on her cheek in a local train in Mumbai in 2015. The man had claimed that he was pushed by fellow commuters, following which he fell on her and his lips accidentally touched her cheeks.

108.title: China sees highest COVID cases since Feb 2020, 1 detected with new subtype of Omicron
108.article_body: China has reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave more than two years ago. State media reported a case infected with a new subtype of the Omicron variant. The new iteration of the virus, isolated from a mild COVID-19 patient, evolved from the BA.1.1 branch of the Omicron variant, Global Times reported.

109.title: On-duty police officer falls after bull hits him in Delhi, video surfaces
109.article_body: In a CCTV footage that has surfaced online, a bull can be seen pushing an on-duty police officer on a road in Delhi. The police officer, Gyaan Singh, can be seen falling to the ground after the animal pushes him. Reports said that after the incident, the constable was taken to the hospital and has now been discharged.

110.title: I get uncomfortable when somebody calls me an OTT star: Rohit Saraf
110.article_body: Rohit Saraf in an interview said, "It makes me uncomfortable when somebody calls me...OTT star." "Because I feel...you're putting me in a box that I'm not willing to be in," he added. "I don't want to label myself an...OTT actor or...film actor. If there's...a street play, and I think it's...something from which I can learn, I'll do it," Rohit said.

111.title: I can't hit such shots even if I start batting again: Aakash on Buttler's 100(68)
111.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has praised RR batter Jos Buttler for his 100 of 68 balls against MI, stating that it "gladdens the heart" to see the 31-year-old bat. "From a batter's point of view, I will not be able to hit such shots even if I start batting again," Aakash added. RR defeated MI by 23 runs in the match.

112.title: 15 Thane school students fall sick due to suspected food poisoning; 4 hospitalised
112.article_body: Around 15 students of an ashram school in Thane's Bhiwandi started vomiting and suffered from diarrhoea after consuming regular meals at the ashram, officials said. While 11 were discharged after primary treatment, four were admitted to the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Hospital in Kalwa. The ashram's general secretary claimed the students suffered from dehydration and not food poisoning.

113.title: You taught me so much: Abhishek shares old pic with Ajay on his b'day
113.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish Ajay Devgn on his birthday. He shared an old picture with Ajay from the set of the 1998 film 'Major Saab', and wrote, "Happy birthday AJ. A photo from...shoot of 'Major Saab'. My first job as a production boy. I knew nothing about a...set and you taught me so much."

114.title: Actress Estelle Harris, voice of Mrs Potato Head in Toy Story films, dies at 93
114.article_body: Veteran American actress Estelle Harris, who voiced the character of Mrs Potato Head in Pixar's 'Toy Story' franchise, has passed away at the age of 93. She died on Saturday at her residence in Palm Desert, California, of natural causes, her son Glen Harris told The Hollywood Reporter. Estelle was also known for her role in the sitcom 'Seinfeld'.

115.title: Ukraine would not have been invaded if I was in White House: Trump
115.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump claimed during a rally that Ukraine's invasion by Russian President Vladimir Putin would never have happened if he was in White House. He also said that when people say he knows Putin it's a "good thing, not a bad thing". Earlier, Trump had said, "The problem isn't that Putin is smart...but...that our leaders are dumb."

116.title: UP man dies as bullet accidentally hits face while fiddling with pistol
116.article_body: A 35-year-old jeweller, Rahul Verma, from Uttar Pradesh died after he accidentally fired from his own licensed pistol. His father said that he was fiddling with the pistol when it accidentally fired. Reports said that a bullet hit Rahul's face. Rahul was rushed to Ram Manohar Lohia hospital where he was declared brought dead.

117.title: Man saved from falling off dilapidated house during AAP roadshow in Guj
117.article_body: A group of men reportedly saved a man from falling off the roof of a multi-story structure in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The incident took place during the road show of the Aam Aadmi Party. Reports said that the people who were accompanying AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann also asked people inside the building to evacuate it.

118.title: Security deployed, Section 144 imposed in Islamabad ahead of no-trust vote against Pak PM
118.article_body: The security has been tightened and Section 144 imposed in Pakistan's Islamabad ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan, which is set to take place in Parliament on Sunday. The administration has ordered a ban on pillion riders across the city. Earlier, Khan had urged people to take to the streets ahead of the motion.

119.title: BJP's poll wins give license to govt to loot people: Randeep Surjewala
119.article_body: Electoral victories for BJP have become a licence for the government to "loot" the people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "The diktat of the cruel, cumbersome and back-breaking price rise imposed by the PM Modi-led government with effect from April 1 has shattered the budget of every household in India," Surjewala added.

120.title: Marriage bureau penalised, told to refund fees for failing to find suitable match
120.article_body: The District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has penalised a marriage bureau in Chandigarh and directed it to refund the complainants' fee after it failed to find a suitable match. The commission observed that the company had exhibited a "negligent and careless attitude". The men whose profiles were shared were "overaged, bald, fat or weren't of desired caste", the commission added.

121.title: Won't condone social media block, useless due to VPN: Sri Lanka min
121.article_body: Sri Lankan Youth and Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa on Sunday tweeted that he'll never condone the blocking of social media platforms in the country. This comes after the country blocked social media platforms over reports of protests being planned amid an economic crisis. "The availability of VPN, just like I'm using now, makes such bans completely useless," he said.

122.title: Karauli incident could’ve been avoided if administration was vigilant: Ex-Raj CM
122.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje condemned the stone-pelting incident in Karauli and said it could have been avoided if the administration was vigilant. Communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring nearly 25 persons. "Hate mentality cannot be allowed to flourish in peace-loving Rajasthan. The administration should take strict action against the culprits," Raje added.

123.title: Algerian man held at Guantanamo Bay for 20 years by US released
123.article_body: The US has released an Algerian man, Sufiyan Barhoumi, imprisoned at the Guantanamo Bay detention centre for about 20 years. Barhoumi, who was captured in Pakistan and sent to Guantanamo in 2002, has been repatriated to his home country, said the Department of Defense. The release comes after the authorities determined he was not a member of Al-Qaeda or Taliban.

124.title: Was contacted by AAP but won't leave Congress: TS Singh Deo
124.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has claimed that he was "contacted" by AAP but asserted that he "won't leave" Congress. "Five generations of my family have been in Congress... (Can't) think beyond Congress," Deo said. "I've not met Arvind Kejriwal but it's true... there are people who contact each other. So, it's not like nobody contacted me," he added.

125.title: Man killed by in-laws for getting married third time in Jharkhand
125.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed allegedly by his in-laws for getting married for the third time in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. According to the police, the skeleton of the deceased, Ladu Haiburu, was inside a well located in a Naxalism-hit area. Haiburu had a fight with his brother-in-law from an earlier marriage and went missing on March 16, police said.

126.title: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif attacked in London, daughter calls for Imran Khan's arrest
126.article_body: Former Pakistani PM Nawaz Sharif was allegedly attacked in London by an activist of PM Imran Khan's PTI party. This comes after Khan said if Sharif's brother, Shehbaz Sharif, takes over then they will do slavery of America. Sharif's daughter, Maryam Nawaz Sharif, called for the arrest of PM Khan, saying he should be booked for "provocation, incitement and sedition".

127.title: Suhana, Khushi to shoot for 40 days in Ooty for Zoya's The Archies: Report
127.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will reportedly shoot for Zoya Akhtar's upcoming project 'The Archies' in Ooty for the next 40 days with a local crew. Earlier, Suhana, Khushi and Agastya's photos from sets of the Archies adaptation had also gone viral on social media.

128.title: Woman was moved by 'The Kashmir...', wanted to feed us with her hands: Producer
128.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal said that while shooting the film, a local woman would bring food for the team. "It was not just for a couple of us, but it was for the entire crew. She was so moved that we were making this film, she wanted to feed us with her hands to express that," he said.

129.title: US agency confirms damage to 112 million years old dinosaur tracks
129.article_body: US' Bureau of Land Management has confirmed minor damages to the dinosaur tracks at Utah's Mill Canyon, which is about 112 million years old, due to machinery used for construction work there. This comes after a palaeontological assessment of the tracks. The agency said that it will follow the assessment's recommendations, seek public input and work with the palaeontology community.

130.title: I would love to but I think he's very busy: John on reuniting with Akshay
130.article_body: John Abraham has said he'd love to work with Akshay Kumar again. "I love Akshay...when we talk about two heroes...who...look good on screen together, it's Akshay and me," John said, adding, "But I think he's very busy...he's doing probably 144 films now? But I'm going to...work with him soon." They've worked together in films like 'Garam Masala' and 'Desi Boyz'.

131.title: 14 killed in floods, mudslides due to heavy rainfall in Brazil
131.article_body: At least 14 people were killed after heavy rainfall triggered floods and mudslides in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state, said authorities. Cars were reportedly swept off as the streets in the coastal towns and cities were flooded. The authorities said that emergency rescue teams moved around 144 people to safety in the affected areas.

132.title: Enjoying my time with GT, two wins in two games, so far so good: Rashid Khan
132.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan has said he's enjoying his time with the franchise and trying to contribute as much as possible. On his bowling against DC, Rashid said, "[In] first over, I tried different grips to see which one is the right one on this wicket." So far, Rashid has picked a wicket each in their two games.

133.title: 50 tonnes of wood gutted as fire breaks out at godown in Gujarat, none injured
133.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of firewood were gutted after a fire broke out at a godown in a four-storey building in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "Prima facie, it appears that welding work was going on in the building when the fire started due to the presence of thinner liquid," a fire official said. It took firefighters over five hours to douse the fire.

134.title: Couple spotted kissing in stands during DC-GT IPL 2022 match, pic goes viral
134.article_body: A couple was spotted kissing in the stands during IPL 2022 match between DC and GT. Reacting to the viral picture, a fan tweeted, "This couple took the IPL match to next level." "Kiss cam in IPL?" another fan wrote. Other tweets read, "IPL is truly going global" and "*Me starts watching IPL with my family*....That one couple: [kisses]."

135.title: Australia record the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history
135.article_body: Australia put up a total of 356/5 against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final, breaking the record for the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest total in a Women's World Cup final was 259/7, registered by Australia in the 2013 edition against West Indies.

136.title: 9 NHAI officials among 22 booked by CBI for corruption in highway projects
136.article_body: Nine officials of NHAI and five companies are among 22 accused booked by the CBI for alleged corruption in the execution and operation of three highway projects. The NHAI officials, including three general manager-level officers, took a monthly bribe to the tune of ₹1-2 lakh from the accused companies, the CBI alleged. The offence took place between 2008 and 2010.

137.title: AAP creates atmosphere via media, nothing on ground: Anurag Thakur
137.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has alleged that AAP creates "an atmosphere via media" but has "nothing on the ground". "He (Arvind Kejriwal) couldn't win a seat in UP, did you see his condition in Uttarakhand, Goa?" Thakur asked the press in Chandigarh. He further said that BJP gets votes "unilaterally" in PM Narendra Modi's name wherever there are elections.

138.title: Ex-Odisha MLA Anup Sai sentenced to life for killing live-in partner, her daughter
138.article_body: Former Odisha MLA and Biju Janata Dal leader Anup Sai has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Chhattisgarh court on charges of murdering his live-in partner and her daughter in 2016. Police claimed Sai conspired to kill her when she insisted on marriage and demanded a share in his property. Sai's driver, another accused in the case, was acquitted.

139.title: I may not accept result of no-confidence vote: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
139.article_body: Ahead of the vote on the no-confidence motion against him on Sunday, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he had "more than one plan" in place and may not accept the move to oust him. Khan urged the country's youth to stage "peaceful protests" against a "foreign conspiracy" allegedly hatched against his government, while asking them not to criticise the Army.

140.title: Dad convinced his doctor that he needed 2 drinks at night to sleep: Ranbir
140.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his father, late actor Rishi Kapoor had the habit of having two drinks every night. Ranbir added that during the early stages of his cancer treatment in the US, he was worried about this routine being disrupted. "He tricked his doctor claiming...he wasn't able to sleep at night and as...remedy, he'd chug down two drinks," Ranbir said.

141.title: Can't deny adoption rights just because man is Muslim: Delhi court
141.article_body: A court in Delhi has granted custody parole to a Muslim prisoner so as to allow him to go sign adoption papers in Haryana. The court observed that the man can't be denied adoption rights just because he's a Muslim. The prosecution had opposed the parole claiming that Muslims can't adopt a child as it's not legally permissible in Islam.

142.title: It's my personal life and I don't like to discuss it: Taapsee on marriage plans
142.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, when asked about marriage plans, said she does not like to discuss her personal life. She also joked about wearing three rings. "In that case, I should be engaged to three people," Taapsee added. She further said she eats in accordance with weather. "Wherever I go...I tell the hotel staff...about my meals...they serve me accordingly," she added.

143.title: Malaika Arora to be discharged from hospital today after car accident
143.article_body: Malaika Arora, who was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai after receiving some minor injuries in a car accident on Saturday, will be discharged from the hospital today. "Malaika has minor injuries on forehead, CT scan has turned out fine and she's currently okay," the hospital said on Saturday. The accident took place when Malaika was returning from Pune.

144.title: PNB branch in Ghaziabad robbed at gunpoint; 4 flee with ₹11 lakh
144.article_body: A Punjab National Bank branch in Ghaziabad was robbed at gunpoint by four men on Saturday, said police. The perpetrators, dressed in black and wearing red masks, fled with ₹11 lakh cash. "They held the staff inside the bank (at gunpoint) and fled with the money. We are ascertaining more information through CCTV footage to identify the accused," said police.

145.title: Drug addict kills sister after argument over domestic issues in Delhi
145.article_body: A drug addict murdered his 24-year-old sister in Delhi. He killed his sister after an argument over domestic issues reportedly broke out between them. Reports said that strangulation marks were found on the victim's neck. The accused confessed to killing his sister during investigation by the police. He also said that both of them were drug addicts.

146.title: Jadeja is under pressure, CSK openers need to perform: Shastri
146.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja is under pressure after suffering consecutive defeats in their two games in the ongoing IPL season. "There's a new captain at the helm, and he's under pressure. Yes, Dhoni is in form but if one of those openers doesn't score then CSK will find it difficult," stated Shastri.

147.title: Domino’s offers free assured surprise gifts worth ₹50 crore
147.article_body: Domino's has announced that it is throwing a birthday party where it's offering surprise gifts with every order. Gifts worth ₹50 crore will be given to customers, it revealed. The free assured surprise gifts can be availed by customers on delivery, dine-in, and takeaway orders via the Domino's app or at their stores.

148.title: Growing trust in India is helping in key deals: Piyush Goyal
148.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's decisions have been able to generate a lot of goodwill for India globally, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. His statement comes as India and Australia signed the Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. On being asked what is facilitating these trade deals, Goyal said, "Growing trust in India is helping in all such developments."

149.title: Pravin Tambe breaks down after watching his biopic with KKR team, video surfaces
149.article_body: Leg-spinner Pravin Tambe, who made his IPL debut aged 41, broke down after he watched the biopic on his life along with the KKR team. The movie 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' was released on Friday and stars Shreyas Talpade. KKR shared a video on Twitter showing Tambe breaking down. "Just never give up on your dreams...Dreams do come true," he said.

150.title: India reports 1,096 new COVID-19 cases, 81 deaths in last 24 hours
150.article_body: India has reported 1,096 new COVID-19 cases and 81 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,260 cases and 83 deaths. Out of the 81 deaths reported today, 16 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 65 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

151.title: Australia's Alyssa Healy records highest-ever score in a World Cup final
151.article_body: Australia opener Alyssa Healy has recorded the highest-ever score in a World Cup final across men's and women's cricket. The 32-year-old scored 170(138) against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final today. She broke the previous record set by former Australian men's wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist, who had scored 149(104) against Sri Lanka in the 2007 World Cup final.

152.title: Remove mosque loudspeakers or will play Hanuman Chalisa there: Raj
152.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday demanded that the Maharashtra government should remove loudspeakers at mosques and said that if this isn't done then loudspeakers will be placed outside mosques and "Hanuman Chalisa will be played at higher volume". "I'm not against prayers, you can pray at...home," he added. Moreover, he demanded that MP and MLA pensions should be stopped.

153.title: Drug trafficker sentenced to 14 yrs in prison by Bahraich court
153.article_body: A Nepal-based drug trafficker, who was arrested by NCB nearly five years ago, was sentenced to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment by a local court in Bahraich, NCB officials said. The court has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him and in case of non-payment of the fine, he will have to remain in prison for two more years.

154.title: Ghaziabad reverses order banning meat sale during Navratri
154.article_body: A day after imposing a ban on sale of raw meat during Navratri from April 2 to 10, the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam reversed the order. In a fresh notification issued on Saturday, the mayor said the regulations by the state government would be followed. The officials said that no such ban has been ordered by the UP government so far.

155.title: Wearing mask is always safer: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray
155.article_body: On the first day of the removal of COVID-19 restrictions in Maharashtra, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday urged people to follow the mask advisory. "Wearing a mask is always safer, don’t feel awkward wearing one for your own safety," Aaditya said. Recently, the Maharashtra government announced that wearing masks is no longer compulsory in the state.

156.title: Chandigarh allows restaurants, bars and hotels to stay open till 3 am
156.article_body: Under Chandigarh's new excise policy, restaurants, bars and hotels in the Union Territory can remain open till 3 am. "The facility of two-hour extension in closure timings [will be] given to restaurants, bars and hotels on payment of additional license fees," an official release stated. Low-alcoholic drinks, including beer and wine, have been exempted from license fees and taxes.

157.title: How can he die suddenly?: Maharashtra minister on Aryan Khan drug case witness
157.article_body: The death of Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness in the drugs-on-cruise case involving Aryan Khan, will be investigated by Maharashtra Police, said the state Home Minister, Dilip Walse Patil. He said people were wondering how "such a strong man could die of a heart attack so suddenly". The minister asked the Director General of Police to investigate Sail's death.

158.title: Broadway's Macbeth performances cancelled after Craig tests COVID +ve
158.article_body: Two performances of Macbeth on Broadway have been cancelled after Daniel Craig tested positive for COVID-19, a statement on the production's official Twitter account read. "We apologise for the inconvenience this causes ticket holders, but the safety of our audiences, the cast and crew remains our top priority," it added. The 54-year-old actor stars in the play opposite Ruth Negga.

159.title: Suspecting wife's extramarital affair, Hyd man kills minor daughter, self
159.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after killing his six-year-old daughter in Hyderabad. Reports said that the man suspected his wife of having an extramarital affair. The man had checked into a lodge with his daughter where he killed her and later died by suicide. His wife had expressed desire to move to Canada for her career after leaving job.

160.title: Did 'chhichhora' roles before Beta; cried when I was offered the film: Aruna
160.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani, who played Anil Kapoor's on-screen mother, Lakshmi Devi, in 'Beta' recalled that it was difficult for her to bag the role in the film even though it was helmed by her brother, Indra Kumar. Aruna added that she cried a lot after she bagged the role. "Before 'Beta', I used to do only chhichhora roles," she said.

161.title: GT's total was not so big, we could've batted better: Pant after defeat
161.article_body: After their 14-run defeat, DC captain Rishabh Pant said GT's 171-run total was not "so big" and they could've batted batter in the game. "[During] the powerplay, we lost three wickets, then in the middle overs we lost three wickets...every match is going to be hard to come back after losing so many wickets," he stated. Pant scored 43(29).

162.title: 16-yr-old booked for filming home tutor in bathroom in Pune
162.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Pune has been booked for recording videos of his English home tutor while she was in the bathroom. The boy was arrested and sent to the District Women and Child Welfare Committee for counselling. "He had developed isolation symptoms during the lockdown period which had a significant impact on his mental state," said police.

163.title: Man, 5-yr-old son accidentally locked up at bank in Punjab; rescued
163.article_body: A man and his five-year-old son who had gotten accidentally locked up at a bank in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday were rescued after about two and a half hours. The father-son duo had come to the bank to deposit some cash. The man claimed he'd called out to the officials when they were pulling down the shutter, but was "ignored".

164.title: 20-yr-old youth arrested for killing his mother's 47-yr-old lover in Mumbai
164.article_body: A 20-year-old youth has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly killing his mother's 47-year-old lover, police said. The incident took place when the accused reached home and found the victim and his mother together. Police added that an argument took place between them and in a fit of rage the youth took a kitchen knife and stabbed the victim.

165.title: DC were ahead till Rishabh was there, but Lockie changed the game: Hardik
165.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya praised pacer Lockie Ferguson for "changing the things" in their game against DC, which they won by 14 runs. Chasing 172 to win, DC were 118/4 in when Lockie dismissed Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel in the 15th over. "Till Rishabh was there...DC were ahead [but] that over really turned it for us," stated Hardik.

166.title: I had no one to talk to, I was depressed for a month: Rohit on World Cup 2011 snub
166.article_body: Talking about not being picked for World Cup 2011 in an interaction with Jemimah Rodrigues, India captain Rohit Sharma said he got the news when he was playing a series in South Africa. "I had no one to talk to at that point. I was just sitting in my room," he stated. Rohit added he was depressed for a month.

167.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 11th time in 13 days
167.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 11th time in 13 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹94.67/litre from ₹93.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.41/litre from ₹117.57/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹102.64/litre from ₹101.79/litre.

168.title: Sri Lanka blocks social media platforms after citizens plan protests against govt
168.article_body: Sri Lanka has blocked social media platforms after reports emerged that citizens were planning to launch protests over economic crisis all over the island despite the curfew. Facebook, Facebook Messenger, Twitter, WhatsApp, YouTube, Snapchat, Twitter Periscope, Google Video, TikTok, Viber, Telegram and Instagram have not been working, reports claimed. Sri Lanka has declared a public emergency.

169.title: My walk is like a duck; had to work hard to bring swag in 'Gangubai...': Alia
169.article_body: Alia Bhatt said her walk in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has a lot of "swag" and she had to work hard for it. "When I watch my own paparazzi videos, I feel like I walk strangely, like a duck. I had to make it more interesting," she added. Alia said she was inspired by Allu Arjun's swag in 'Pushpa' for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'.

170.title: Bengaluru boy makes hoax bomb call to rly police over PUBG partner
170.article_body: A 12-year-old boy allegedly made a hoax bomb threat call to Railway police helpline to stop his classmate from boarding a train as he'd lose his PUBG partner and would have to stop playing. The boy had called around 2 pm on March 30 claiming that there was a bomb at Yelahanka railway station, causing its closure for 90 minutes.

171.title: PMC starts collecting ₹50 daily from illegal hawkers on roads
171.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has started collecting ₹50 daily from roadside hawkers doing business illegally from April 1. The money will be used for the purpose of garbage collection and administrative work. "These illegal hawkers use the public space and often surround it with garbage which is later supposed to be cleaned up by the PMC," said an official.

172.title: Mysterious lights spotted in sky in Maharashtra, MP, Gujarat; pics go viral
172.article_body: People in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat witnessed mysterious trail of lights in the sky on Saturday. Astronomer Jonathan McDowell referred to the event seen over the states as a possible "re-entry of a Chinese rocket stage" that was launched in February 2021. Several experts also speculated that event could be a "meteor shower".

173.title: 42-year-old man killed, his body hanged from iron pipe in Pune
173.article_body: An unidentified person has been booked after a 42-year-old man was allegedly killed and then his body was hanged from an iron pipe to pass it off as suicide in Pune. A post-mortem report revealed that the deceased, whose body was found on Friday, died due to strangulation and head injury. An investigation is on to identify the accused.

174.title: Delhi policeman out with family attacked with knife for scolding man for rash driving
174.article_body: A Delhi Police sub-inspector who was out with his wife and two-year-old daughter was attacked with a knife after he confronted and scolded a man for driving rashly in a local market in Delhi. The policeman had asked the man to drive properly, following which the driver misbehaved with him, an officer said. An FIR was registered in this connection.

175.title: Hyd man demands action against man smoking near temple, police respond
175.article_body: A Twitter user asked Hyderabad Police on Saturday to take action against another man who allegedly refused to stop smoking near a temple when he was asked to do so. "He simply replied...'I'm not afraid of anyone'...Can we have any anti squad team for taking...action against...such things," the user wrote.
