Hyderabad Police asked him to share location of the incident.

176.title: Tesla delivers record 3,10,048 cars in Q1 as Musk calls it 'difficult quarter'
176.article_body: Tesla reported that it delivered record number of electric vehicles in the first quarter of 2022, despite ongoing supply chain challenges and factory shutdowns. Tesla said it delivered 3,10,048 vehicles during the first three months of this year. "This was an exceptionally difficult quarter due to supply chain interruptions & China's Zero COVID policy," Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk said.

177.title: People may have lost their mind: Binance's billionaire CEO on NFT craze
177.article_body: Crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao, speaking about the NFT craze, said, "People may have lost their mind." Referring to the NFT artwork which sold for $69.3 million last year, Zhao asked, "Nothing is worth that much, right?" The billionaire added that NFTs (non-fungible tokens) allow artists to monetise their work globally again and reach a much wider audience.

178.title: GT defeat DC to record 2nd win in a row, Shubman smashes his highest T20 score
178.article_body: GT defeated DC by 14 runs to register their second win a row in IPL 2022. The match witnessed GT opener Shubman Gill smash his highest score in T20s. Shubman scored 84 runs off 46 deliveries to help GT put up a total of 171/6. GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson took four wickets as DC managed 157/9 in 20 overs.

179.title: 50 cattle being illegally transported recovered by Assam Police
179.article_body: The Assam Police on Friday recovered 50 cattle that were allegedly being illegally transported in two vehicles and arrested one person in connection with the incident. The cattle were being taken from Upper Assam to Nagaon. Sharing pictures of the cattle on Twitter, police wrote, "Two cattle vehicles were apprehended by Nagaon Police at Jajori PS and Borghat PP."

180.title: PM Modi extends greetings on commencement of Ramzan
180.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conveyed his greetings on the commencement of Ramzan. "May this holy month inspire people to serve the poor. May it also further enhance the spirit of peace, harmony and compassion in our society," he said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi also tweeted, "Ramzan Mubarak! May this pious month bring good health, peace and prosperity to all."

181.title: 2 arrested in HP's Shimla for consuming heroin near hospital gate
181.article_body: Two people, allegedly consuming heroin outside the Indira Gandhi Medical College and Hospital's (IGMC) gate in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, were arrested by the police's Special Investigation Unit on Saturday. Police said that around 4.02 grams of the drug were also recovered from their possession. A case has been registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police added.

182.title: Pakistan win an ODI series against Australia in 20 years
182.article_body: Pakistan beat Australia by nine wickets in third and final ODI in Lahore to clinch the three-match series 2-1. Haris Rauf's 3/39 and Mohammad Wasim's 3/40 helped Pakistan restrict Australia at 210, while an unbeaten 190-run second-wicket stand between skipper Babar Azam (105*) and Imam-ul-Haq's (89*) helped hosts win. It's Pakistan's first ODI series win against Australia in 20 years.

183.title: Sachin paaji said 'Build a partnership' as I walked in after his wicket: Kohli on WC final
183.article_body: Recalling 2011 World Cup final, which India won by defeating Sri Lanka on April 2, 2011, Virat Kohli said, "I remember the pressure of walking in to bat at two down...Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag...both were out." He added, "When I walked in...Sachin paaji said, 'Build a partnership'. We did build a partnership, me and Gautam Gambhir."

184.title: Move to the streets in interest of nation: Pak PM a day ahead of no-trust vote
184.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Saturday told people to take to the streets, a day ahead of the scheduled vote on the no-confidence motion tabled against him in the National Assembly. "You should do so (protest on the streets) for your conscience, in the interest of this nation," said Khan, during a Q&A session with the Pakistani public.

185.title: Retreating Russian troops planting mines in northern Ukraine: Prez
185.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday accused Russian forces of deliberately mining areas in northern Ukraine during their retreat from the region. "They are mining all this territory. Houses are mined, equipment is mined, even the bodies of dead people," he said. The retreat comes after Russia announced this week it would scale down military operations around Kyiv and Chernihiv.

186.title: 1st Kayaking & Canoeing marathon held on river Jhelum in J&K's Srinagar
186.article_body: The first-ever Kayaking and Canoeing marathon was held in J&K's Srinagar on Saturday. The marathon started from the Zero Bridge to Habba Kadal bridge on the Jhelum river. This event was organised as a part of 'My Youth, My Pride', J&K Sports Council Secretary, Nuzhat Gul, said, adding, "I urge...society to join hands and help keep...youths away from drugs."

187.title: Power regulator caps prices at ₹12/unit at exchanges amid rising demand
187.article_body:
The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission has asked the electricity exchanges to cap prices at 
₹12 per unit amid a surge in power demand. The power regulator said prices at power exchanges have remained "significantly" higher during the last few days. "Abnormally high price...is not only against consumer interest but also erodes the buyer's confidence in the market's credibility," it added.

188.title: Pakistan's Babar Azam creates history, becomes fastest batter to reach 16 ODI hundreds
188.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has created history by becoming the fastest batter to reach 16 hundreds in ODI cricket, achieving the feat during the third ODI against Australia in Lahore. The 27-year-old batter reached the milestone in his 84th ODI innings. The previous record was held by ex-South Africa batter Hashim Amla, who reached 16 hundreds in 94 ODI innings.

189.title: We tried everything but couldn't get him out: Rohit on Buttler's ton
189.article_body: Referring to Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, five-time champions MI's skipper Rohit Sharma said the RR opener played an "exceptional" innings. "We tried everything but we could not get him out. But, he played really well," he added. Notably, it's the first century of this season's IPL. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

190.title: German man gets 87 COVID-19 vaccine shots, held for selling vaccine passports
190.article_body: A 61-year-old German man has been arrested after he received at least 87 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. As per a report, the man was paid by people who were against vaccination and he would get the vaccine so as to sell vaccination passports to such people. He reportedly received vaccine doses up to three times daily at different centres.

191.title: A 'powerful country' backing India is angry with Pakistan: Imran Khan
191.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that a "powerful country" which is backing India is angry with Pakistan because of his recent visit to Russia to meet President Vladimir Putin. His remarks came after his government summoned the US Charge d'Affaires in Islamabad to lodge a protest over US' alleged attempt to interfere with the country's internal affairs.

192.title: Illegal gun factory busted in Jharkhand's Dumka, 6 arrested
192.article_body: A joint team of Jharkhand Police and Kolkata Police raided an illegal gun factory in Jharkhand’s Dumka district on Saturday and seized a large number of unfinished pistols and revolvers. Six people from Bihar and Jharkhand, including a woman, were arrested, police said adding that the raid was conducted based on inputs provided by a person arrested by Kolkata Police.

193.title: Sec 144 imposed as 25 hurt in communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli
193.article_body: After communal clashes broke out in Rajasthan's Karauli injuring nearly 25 persons, Section 144 was imposed from 6:30 pm on Saturday till midnight on April 4. DM Rajendra Singh Shekhawat said internet services will remain suspended till midnight tomorrow. Reportedly, stones were pelted when a bike rally passed through a Muslim-dominated area. CM Ashok Gehlot urged people to maintain peace.

194.title: Soldier's wife hacked to death at Punjab home, axe found near body
194.article_body: A 38-year-old soldier found his wife hacked to death at their home in Punjab after he returned on Friday following his retirement, police said. "My wife was attacked on...face with...sharp-edged weapon. I found a blood-stained axe near...body," Jasbir Singh said in his complaint. Police said that the woman had no enmity with anyone and they are investigating from various angles.

195.title: Nepal's electricity supply to India to rise significantly: Official
195.article_body: The supply of electricity from Nepal to India will be enhanced significantly in 2022 as compared to the previous year, Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla said on Saturday. Shringla made the remark after a meeting between PM Narendra Modi and Nepal's PM Sher Bahadur Deuba today. Both sides discussed harnessing water resources for mutual benefits, he added.

196.title: See the respect given to Indian passport: Pak PM while praising India's foreign policy
196.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has praised India's foreign policy. "Look at the foreign policy of India. When there was cold war between Soviet Union and the US, they remained non-aligned," he said. "Because of India's foreign policy, see the respect given to the passport of India and the respect given to Pakistan passport," Khan added.

197.title: AAP is a party without ideology, it only shows dreams to people: Cong
197.article_body: Congress Himachal Pradesh President Kuldeep Rathore on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party a party without an ideology that only shows dreams to people. He added that a direct competition between Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party will take place in the Assembly elections in the state. Notably, AAP had said that it'll contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh elections.

198.title: Meteorologist in US pauses live telecast to call family about tornado warning
198.article_body: A meteorologist in the US paused his live broadcast on television to call his family to check if they knew about a nearby tornado warning. Sharing a video of his incident, Doug Kammerer wrote, "Had to warn my family! Kids were home alone and I knew they were not watching me on TV!...Scary moment for me though."

199.title: At least 20 dead bodies spotted lying on Ukrainian street; video surfaces
199.article_body: At least 20 dead bodies were spotted lying on a street in Ukrainian town of Bucha after Russian strikes. A video showed that one of the bodies had his hands tied and the corpses were strewn over several hundred metres of the residential road. Ukrainian forces reportedly retook the town of Bucha.

200.title: Ukrainian journalist killed covering Russia-Ukraine conflict
200.article_body: A Ukrainian journalist, Maksim Levin, has been found dead in a village north of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv after going missing more than two weeks ago. The prosecutor general's office in Ukraine said that Levin was "killed by servicemen of the Russian Armed Forces with two shots from small arms". He is survived by his wife and four children.

201.title: Pic shows Malaika Arora's damaged car after accident
201.article_body: A picture of Malaika Arora's damaged car after a road accident, in which three vehicles rammed into each other, has surfaced online. While the front and the last vehicles were tourist cars, Arora was in her Range Rover in between both the cars. She was rushed to the hospital after she reportedly received an injury near her eye.

202.title: Wear mask as long as Ajit Pawar and I continue to wear it: Maha CM
202.article_body: Days after Maharashtra government said it isn't mandatory to wear masks, CM Uddhav Thackeray urged people to wear masks for as long as he and his deputy Ajit Pawar continue to wear them. "I saw most people didn't wear masks...The...two people who have continued wearing masks...(are) me and Pawar...I would urge people to continue to cover their faces," he said.

203.title: It's a joke: Tharoor as pic of him as 'child actor' goes viral on April Fool's Day
203.article_body: After film writer Vaibhav Vishal's picture claiming to show Congress MP Shashi Tharoor as a "child star" on April Fool's Day went viral, the MP on Saturday clarified, "It's a joke!" He added, "He's pulling my leg and I am playing along for fun." Tharoor had earlier commented on the picture, "I'd tried to keep it secret...Good sleuthing."

204.title: It's not always easy: Shardul on playing for DC after 4 years with CSK
204.article_body: Speaking about moving to DC after playing for CSK for four years, all-rounder Shardul Thakur said it's not always easy. "It's a different management altogether here, so [I'm] getting used to it...it has been an honour to work with these guys," he added. Shardul was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore in IPL mega auction 2022 in February.

205.title: Revolutionary move: Rijiju on withdrawal of AFSPA from NE areas
205.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday called the Centre's decision to withdraw AFSPA from major areas of Assam, Nagaland and Manipur a "revolutionary move". The minister said, "When AFSPA is withdrawn, it means that peace has returned to that area." He added that the development that the Northeast has seen under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi is "historic".

206.title: Once he gets fit, he comes straight in MI playing XI: Rohit on Suryakumar
206.article_body: On being asked whether batter Suryakumar Yadav will play for MI in their next match after their second straight loss in IPL 2022, skipper Rohit Sharma said, "He's a key player for us." He added, "Once he gets fit, he comes in straight but we want him to recover since finger injuries are tricky." MI was defeated by RR today.

207.title: Delighted 44th FIDE Chess Olympiad is happening in India: Anand
207.article_body: Five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said he's delighted with India winning the bid to host 44th FIDE Chess Olympiad 2022. "Full credit to Tamil Nadu government and All India Chess Federation (AICF) for moving so fast," he added. Notably, Chess Olympiad will be held in India for first time and will take place in July-August in Anand's hometown Chennai.

208.title: 'RRR' writer deserves Padma Vibhushan, Rajamouli is king: Kangana
208.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a video on Instagram appreciating 'RRR', saying writer KV Vijayendra Prasad deserves India's second-highest civilian honour Padma Vibhushan. "At the age of 80, he is one of India's busiest writers. He writes in 15 days while others take years to complete a story," she said. Kangana further called SS Rajamouli a king for making the film.

209.title: Ukraine's gold, forex reserves stand at pre-war level: Official
209.article_body: A senior Ukrainian official on Saturday announced that Ukraine's gold and foreign currency reserves stand at $29 billion, the same level as before Russia's invasion. The reserves have remained at the pre-war level mainly due to external financial support for the country. The reserves had dropped to $27.5 billion before rising to the current level, the official said.

210.title: Malaika Arora admitted to hospital after car accident
210.article_body: Malaika Arora was taken to the Apollo hospital for treatment after she received injury near her eye in a pile-up between vehicles near Mumbai. Three vehicles rammed onto each other and all three vehicles have received damages. The police have made a mention of the incident and an FIR will be registered after investigating how the accident happened.

211.title: 2 civilians shot at by Army mistakenly in Arunachal Pradesh
211.article_body: Two civilians were injured by the Army in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap district on Friday in a case of mistaken identity. They were returning home after fishing in a river. "The visibility was not clear...When the army fired, the boys started shouting that they were civilians and not to shoot them," Tirap DC said. They were taken to Assam for treatment.

212.title: Putin bathes in blood from deer antlers, cancer doctor accompanied him on trips: Report
212.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin takes bath in blood extracted from deer antlers to boost his health, a Russian news outlet reported. It also reported that Putin took frequent trips to the resort city of Sochi in the company of oncology surgeon specialising in thyroid cancer several times in last four years. The antlers are reportedly cut while deer are alive.

213.title: UK watchdog suspends Khalsa TV licence over Khalistani propaganda
213.article_body: The UK's media watchdog, the Office of Communications (Ofcom), on Saturday announced that it has suspended the broadcast licence of Khalsa Television Limited. The order was issued over KTV channel's broadcast of a programme that promoted Khalistani propaganda. The content "promoted violent action, including murder, as...acceptable...form of action to further the Khalistani cause", Ofcom said.

214.title: BJP full of arrogance, give AAP a chance in Gujarat: Kejriwal
214.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who held a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Saturday ahead of Gujarat polls scheduled for later this year, said BJP has become arrogant after being in power for 25 years. He urged people to give a chance to Aam Aadmi Party. "If you do not like it, change the government and bring them back," Kejriwal said.

215.title: Woman uses her red saree to signal train to stop after seeing broken track in UP
215.article_body: A woman in UP's Etah prevented a train accident by hanging her red saree on railway track to signal a train to stop after noticing damage to the track. Pictures from the incident showed the saree propped up in the middle of the track with the help of wooden sticks. The train going to Tudla stopped after getting the signal.

216.title: Woman ordered to pay alimony to her ex-husband by Bombay HC
216.article_body: Bombay High Court has upheld orders passed by a local court in Maharashtra's Nanded, directing a woman teacher to pay alimony to her former husband. The man claimed that he had no source of income and he suffered from some health issues that had rendered him unfit for working. The local court had directed her to pay maintenance of ₹3,000/month.

217.title: Who are the world's 10 richest people as Adani enters $100 billion club?
217.article_body: Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $273 billion fortune, Bloomberg said, followed by Jeff Bezos ($188 billion). While Gautam Adani is 10th richest with $100 billion wealth, the list includes Bernard Arnault ($148 billion), Bill Gates ($133 billion) and Warren Buffett ($127 billion). Google Co-founders Larry Page ($125 billion) and Sergey Brin ($119 billion) rank sixth and seventh.

218.title: I'm a big screen hero, don't want to step into OTT: John Abraham
218.article_body: Actor John Abraham has stated that he is a big screen hero and only wants to be seen on the big screen. "There's nothing wrong with it but I don't think I am ready for [stepping into OTT] today," the actor added. He further said that he has no problem even if he fails but only on the big screen.

219.title: 'Mahabharat' actor Rohit Bhardwaj announces separation from wife after 16 yrs of marriage
219.article_body: Television actor Rohit Bhardwaj, best known for playing Yudhishthira in 'Mahabharat', has revealed that he is separating from his wife Poonam Bhardwaj after 16 years of marriage. "The divorce is in the process and should be through in two months," he stated. Rohit further said he hasn't seen his daughter in two years.

220.title: Tom Hanks officiates couple's wedding in their unfinished home in US, pics surface
220.article_body: Actor Tom Hanks officiated a couple’s wedding in their unfinished house in Pittsburgh after the bride wrote a letter to him requesting if he would perform the ceremony. Krisna Poznik had been engaged to her partner for nearly five years and recalled Hanks doing something similar for a couple in 2016. Notably, Tom Hanks is an ordained minister.

221.title: TN CM and DMK chief MK Stalin inaugurates party's new office in Delhi
221.article_body: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) chief and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday inaugurated the party's new office 'Anna-Kalaignar Arivalayam' in Delhi at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Congress leader Sonia Gandhi was also present during the inauguration. Notably, Stalin, who's on a three-day visit to Delhi, visited government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday.

222.title: Warring parties agree to 2-month truce in Yemen: UN
222.article_body: The warring sides in Yemen have agreed to a two-month nationwide truce from Saturday, the UN envoy to Yemen said. The deal between Yemen's government, backed by a Saudi-led military coalition, and Houthi rebels aims "to give Yemenis a necessary break from violence", the UN envoy added. Notably, Saturday marks the start of the Muslim holy month of Ramzan.

223.title: Haryana makes masks optional, no fine for not wearing them in public
223.article_body: Amid a dip in coronavirus cases, the Haryana government, led by CM ML Khattar, issued an order on Saturday saying that it's no longer mandatory to wear masks in public places and workplaces. It added that those not wearing masks won't be fined ₹500. However, the general public was advised to follow coronavirus-appropriate behaviour, use face masks and hand sanitisers.

224.title: Man crashes his ₹2.5 crore Ferrari just after buying it in UK; pic goes viral
224.article_body: A man in the UK's Derby crashed his brand new Ferrari worth around ₹2.5 crore just after buying it. Photos shared by police show the front bonnet crumpled with scratches all across the front of the car. "Driver bought a Ferrari this morning and crashed it after driving it less than 2 miles. No injuries. #DriveToArrive," police wrote.

225.title: What is known about the new COVID-19 variant 'XE' that WHO has warned against?
225.article_body: WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of COVID-19, which is a hybrid of two sublineages of the Omicron variant- BA.1 and BA.2. First detected in the UK on January 19, the 'XE' variant's rate of infection has been found in preliminary studies to be 10% higher than that of BA.2 (considered most contagious till now), WHO said.

226.title: Delhi & Punjab done, ready for Guj: Mann in roadshow with Kejriwal
226.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls scheduled for later this year. "Delhi and Punjab sorted, now we are ready for Gujarat," Mann said. Kejriwal claimed he ended corruption in Delhi. "I don't know how to do politics but...know how to end corruption," he said.

227.title: Chris Rock's fan shouts 'f**k Will Smith' during his show, comedian replies 'No, no'
227.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock stopped a fan who was abusing Will Smith during a live performance in Boston on Thursday, according to People magazine. "No, no, no, no, no," Chris Rock immediately replied. At Rock's shows on Wednesday, his first appearance since presenting at the Academy Awards where he was slapped by Smith, he said he was "still processing what happened".

228.title: At least 35 killed in strike on Ukraine's Mykolaiv: Governor
228.article_body: At least 35 people were killed in a rocket strike on a regional administration building in Ukraine's Mykolaiv. Reportedly, rescue workers have continued to dismantle the rubble and search for victims after the rocket strike. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians including 115 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

229.title: Cameraman gets hit by six from MI's Tilak Varma, Trent Boult's reaction goes viral
229.article_body: Mumbai Indians batting all-rounder Tilak Varma smashed a six over long-off on the bowling of Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag, which went on to hit a cameraman. The reaction of RR fast bowler Trent Boult, who was fielding at long-off, went viral. Boult was seen putting hands on his head before checking up on the cameraman.

230.title: 5-time champions MI lose two matches in a row as RR register 2nd straight win
230.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated five-time champions Mumbai Indians (MI) by 23 runs to register their second straight win in IPL 2022. MI have now lost their first two matches in IPL 2022. The match witnessed RR opener Jos Buttler becoming the first batter to slam a hundred in IPL 2022. Buttler scored 100(68), including 11 fours and five sixes.

231.title: Ready-to-eat popcorn to attract 18% GST, clarifies Telangana AAR
231.article_body: Ready-to-eat popcorn is prepared by swelling maize corn and should attract 18% GST, Telangana Authority for Advanced Ruling (AAR) has clarified. It noted that ready-to-eat popcorn falls under the category of prepared foods obtained by swelling or roasting of cereals or cereal products. It "clearly does not fall under" the category pertaining to preparations of vegetables, fruits, nuts, it added.

232.title: How's the Jos, very high sir: Mishra after Buttler hit 1st ton of IPL 2022
232.article_body: Following RR opener Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "How's the Jos...high, very high sir! A deadly display of batting by Buttler, just like we all expect him to do." He added, "First century of IPL 2022. Heart goes out for the bowlers who have to bowl him in such scorching heat."

233.title: South Africa crosses 1 lakh COVID-19 deaths since pandemic began
233.article_body: South Africa's National Institute for Communicable Diseases on Friday said the country reported 1,00,020 deaths since the pandemic began. However, the government still plans to lift the lockdown restrictions soon. Deputy President David Mabuza said government has no plans to introduce a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine policy in the country. Meanwhile, South Africa logged 1,692 cases on Friday.

234.title: Sudan's miltary leader who led coup threatens to expel UN envoy
234.article_body: Sudan's military leader General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan on Friday threatened to expel UN special representative Volker Perthes, accusing him of overstepping the mandate. "We heard his slander the other day, lying, blatantly lying," said al-Burhan. This comes after Perthes warned Sudan was heading for "an economic and security collapse". Sudan plunged into crisis after last year's military coup.

235.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinians in a raid in occupied West Bank
235.article_body: Israeli forces on Saturday said three members of Palestinian Islamic Jihad were killed during a raid in the occupied West Bank near the city of Jenin. As per a statement by the Israeli police, three Palestinians were killed when they opened fire on Israeli troops leading to a shoot-out. They added that four soldiers were wounded in the operation.

236.title: Becoming director as you're not good-looking to be star not a reason: Karan
236.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has condemned those who become directors because they weren't "good-looking enough" to become movie stars. "That cannot be the reason why you are a director. It cannot be your plan B," the filmmaker added. He further said that aspiring directors must be familiar with the work of great directors like Pedro Almodóvar, SS Rajamouli and Steven Spielberg.

237.title: Mali's military kills over 200 Islamic militants in Moura region
237.article_body: Mali's military on Friday said they killed 203 Islamic militants during an operation carried out in Moura region in March. "This operation follows very precise information that made it possible to locate the holding of a meeting between various militants in Moura," a military statement said. The military added they arrested 51 people and seized large quantities of weapons too.

238.title: We seek to expand relations with US: Pak Army chief after PM's 'foreign conspiracy' claim
238.article_body: Pakistan's army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa has said his country sought to expand its relationship with US, a day after Pakistan protested to the US embassy over alleged interference in its internal affairs. PM Imran Khan had said that Pakistan gave a protest note to the embassy over what he described as foreign conspiracy to oust him from power.

239.title: Hopefully I can put on a display for DC fans: Powell ahead of DC vs GT
239.article_body: Ahead of Delhi Capitals-Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, DC batter Rovman Powell, who was out for a duck in his side's first match, said he's looking forward to scoring some runs. "Hopefully, I can put on a display for the Delhi Capitals fans," he added. The match will be played today at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune.

240.title: DC to field first against GT, playing XIs announced
240.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to field first against GT in their IPL 2022 match at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune. GT are fielding the same playing XI, while Kamlesh Nagarkoti has been replaced by Mustafizur Rahman in DC's playing XI. Notably, both the teams had won their opening matches in IPL 2022.

241.title: Akshay Kumar was never approached for 'The Kashmir Files': Producer
241.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal has revealed that actor Akshay Kumar was never approached for the film. He further said neither he nor director Vivek Agnihotri thought about the commercial aspect of the film, adding that the cast features performers and not stars. "Vivek was...very specific so we brought Darshan (Kumaar) on board [to portray Krishna Pandit]," Abhishek added.

242.title: My directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for me: Remo
242.article_body: Choreographer-director Remo D'souza has stated that his directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for him in many ways. He further said that the word 'faltu' (useless) was attached to him since he was young. "It was my way of telling...naysayers that no life choice made by anyone is ever 'faltu' especially when those are the unconventional ones," Remo added.

243.title: Cyberabad Police announces short film contest on drug abuse theme
243.article_body: The Cyberabad Police has announced a short film contest on the theme 'Spreading Awareness on Drug Abuse'. Sharing the registration link on Twitter, the force informed that participants can submit 60 to 120 second-long videos in English, Hindi or Telugu with subtitles. The first prize winner will get ₹50,000 while second and third will receive ₹30,000 and ₹20,000 respectively.

244.title: Restoration of Hyderabad's Kali Kaman completed, pictures released
244.article_body: The restoration work at Kali Kaman, one of the four arches near Hyderabad's Charminar, has been completed. The before and after photos of the Kaman were shared on Twitter by Telangana Special Chief Secretary, Municipal Administration, Arvind Kumar on Saturday. The project was undertaken by the municipal corporation and Telangana Heritage Department last year and reportedly cost ₹1.48 crore.

245.title: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray flags off Metro lines 2A and 7 in Mumbai
245.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray inaugurated two Metro lines in Mumbai on the occasion of Gudi Padwa on Saturday. The lines will begin full operations on April 3 with Metro 2A, running from Dahisar west to DN Nagar and Metro 7, from Dahisar east to Andheri east. There are around 60 drivers to operate the trains, MMRDA Commissioner, SVR Srinivas, said.

246.title: Manipur to honour Irom Sharmila for 16-yr-long anti-AFSPA movement
246.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh has said the state government will honour Irom Chanu Sharmila for her 16-year-long hunger strike against the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA). "I...appreciate...Sharmila who sacrificed half of her life staging dharna," Singh said. She started her hunger strike in 2000 after 10 civilians were allegedly killed by security forces. Her strike ended in 2016.

247.title: Himalaya clarifies on its halal policy after users call for #BoycottHimalaya
247.article_body: Himalaya on Friday issued a statement after a group of people started to call for #BoycottHimalaya over its halal policy. The company said, "None of the Himalaya products contain meat, as alleged in some of the social media platforms; this is factually incorrect." It added, that halal certification "does not imply that a product contains animal-derived ingredients."

248.title: ₹1.29 cr siphoned off from dead doctor's bank account in Mumbai
248.article_body: Two former housekeeping staff members of the SBI Goregaon branch allegedly siphoned off ₹1.29 crore from the bank account of a Kolkata-based doctor, who had died in 2014. The accused, who reportedly entered the bank during the lockdown on the pretext of cleaning, accessed the bank's systems, updated KYC and changed the mobile number linked to the account.

249.title: Mumbai's 'Sunday Streets' to be hosted at 3 more locations
249.article_body: After 'Sunday Streets' was held at six locations in the city last week, Mumbai Police decided to add three more roads that will be made traffic-free for a few hours every Sunday. From April 3, people will also be able to engage in fun activities on streets of Chembur's Chimni garden, Dahisar's IC Colony and Kandivali's Thakur Village.

250.title: 4-team series involving India, Pakistan can bring in revenue of ₹5,000 crore: PCB
250.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said their proposed four-team T20I tournament involving India, Pakistan, England and Australia can bring in revenue of around ₹5,000 crore for the four participants as well as the ICC. Pakistan will formally present the proposal at the ICC Board meeting next week in Dubai. "It will become a much-anticipated event," a PCB official told ESPNcricinfo.

251.title: 7 bus drivers fined on 1st day of lane discipline drive in Delhi
251.article_body: Seven drivers of DTC and cluster buses were fined ₹10,000 each on Friday, the first day of the lane discipline enforcement drive. The first violation will attract a fine of ₹10,000, the second will invite prosecution under the Motor Vehicles Act, the third will get the driving licence suspended and the fourth will lead to termination of the vehicle's permit.

252.title: I grew up watching Ajay Devgn, he was superstar then & now: Jr NTR
252.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has stated that he has grown up watching actor Ajay Devgn's films. "He was our very own action superstar then and he is now," the actor added. He further said that Ajay's entry standing on two bikes in 'Phool Aur Kaante' was crazy for him, adding that he used to wonder if he can do it.

253.title: Aren't your words extreme? Jungkook to troll saying 'Eat dog sh*t'
253.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram during which a social media user wrote, "Are you bored? Eat dog sh*t." Jungkook responded to the user writing, "Aren't your words really extreme? If you crumble up choco pie, the shape looks similar." He is quarantined in Las Vegas after testing positive for COVID-19.

254.title: Sri Lanka imposes nationwide curfew till Monday amid economic crisis
254.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday imposed a nationwide curfew until Monday morning amid growing unrest in the country due to a severe economic crisis. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had imposed a state of emergency earlier this week after public protests over the crisis turned violent. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

255.title: Joss the boss: Harbhajan on Buttler being 1st player to hit 100 in IPL 2022
255.article_body: After Jos Buttler became the first player to score a century in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and said, "Joss the boss...what a 100 Buttler, class." The RR opener scored 100 off 68 balls against MI at DY Patil Stadium, Mumbai. He hit 11 fours and five sixes during his ton. RR scored 193/8 in 20 overs.

256.title: Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal starts following PM, UP CM on Twitter
256.article_body: Amid reports of a rift with his nephew and SP President Akhilesh Yadav, PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday started following PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Twitter. Notably, this comes after Yadav met CM Adityanath in Lucknow on Wednesday. Earlier, Yadav had claimed he was not invited to the SP Legislature Party meeting.

257.title: Employee holding civil post has to act with utmost good faith: SC
257.article_body: Supreme Court has said that an employee desirous of holding a civil post has to act with utmost good faith and truthfulness. The remarks came as the court upheld the sacking of a teacher for not disclosing a criminal case registered against him in the official forms. The man had joined as a trained graduate teacher of mathematics in Delhi.

258.title: Oscars Academy accepts Smith's resignation, to continue with disciplinary proceedings
258.article_body: David Rubin, president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, has said that the Academy has accepted Will Smith's resignation following the Oscars slapping incident. "We'll continue to move forward with our disciplinary proceedings against Mr Smith for violations of the Academy's Standards of Conduct, in advance of our next scheduled board meeting on April 18," he added.

259.title: Scientists to send pic depicting naked man & woman to space for aliens
259.article_body: Scientists have developed a binary-coded new message, which includes a representation of naked man and woman, that will be beamed to aliens that might exist in the Milky Way. "The proposed message includes basic mathematical and physical concepts...The message concludes with digitised images of the human form, along with an invitation for any receiving intelligences to respond," they said.

260.title: PM Modi gifts miniature painting from Himachal to Nepal PM Deuba, pic released
260.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has gifted a miniature painting from Himachal Pradesh to Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, during the latter's first visit to India as PM. The traditional 'Pahari School' painting depicts the season of monsoon. It shows Lord Krishna and Radha holding hands and it's representative of the painting style that originated in Kangra.

261.title: Ariana Grande pledges to donate $1.5mn to fight anti-trans bills
261.article_body: Singer Ariana Grande has pledged to match up to $1.5 million (almost ₹11.4 crore) in donations to LGBTQ advocacy groups amid the anti-trans rights bills in the US state legislature. She wrote on Instagram, "Right now there are hundreds of disgraceful bills pending in state legislature that target trans youth and aim to curb their rights."

262.title: Imposter befriends Mumbai woman on Facebook, cheats her of ₹15 lakh
262.article_body: An imposter allegedly defrauded a 42-year-old Mumbai businesswoman of ₹15.6 lakh. The accused reportedly posed as a UK businessman on Facebook initially and told the victim he was sending a gift. He later called her pretending to be a customs official and asked her to pay a penalty against the gift and $70,000 that had arrived at the airport.

263.title: Pradeep Mehra receives ₹2.5 lakh from Shoppers Stop, Kapri shares post
263.article_body: Shoppers Stop has given a cheque of ₹2.5 lakh to 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for his mother’s treatment and to accomplish his dream of joining the Indian Army. Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted about this and wrote, "Midnight runner Pradeep Mehra is overwhelmed with all the love and support." Earlier in March, Mehra's video of running in Noida had gone viral.

264.title: Commendable: Raina on GT skipper Hardik's comeback as bowler in IPL
264.article_body: Calling Hardik Pandya's comeback as a bowler in his side's five-wicket win against LSG in IPL 2022 "commendable", ex-CSK player Suresh Raina said GT skipper is looking fit. Irfan Pathan praised Hardik and said he's not putting much strain on his back as he's not trying to bend a lot while releasing the ball. Hardik registered bowling figures of 4-0-37-0.

265.title: 6-yr-old girl on picnic dies after she slips & falls into pool in Mumbai
265.article_body: A six-year-old girl, who was on a picnic with her family, died after she slipped and drowned in a swimming pool on the eve of Gudi-Padwa at a private bungalow in Uttan near Mumbai. According to police, the deceased girl's parents were having breakfast when the incident took place. Meanwhile, police have registered an accidental death report into the matter.

266.title: Cooperation in Space possible only after removal of sanctions: Russia
266.article_body: Roscosmos Director General Dmitry Rogozin on Saturday said restoration of normal relations between the partners at the International Space Station (ISS) and other projects would be possible only once Western sanctions against Moscow are lifted. He added that plans to end cooperation over ISS with space agencies of US, Canada, EU and Japan will soon be reported to Russian authorities.

267.title: India to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
267.article_body: India is set to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid the latter’s economic crisis. The 40,000-tonne shipment is part of the 3,00,000 tonnes India will supply to Sri Lanka in the next few months. Notably, Sri Lanka has announced a state of emergency after violent protests erupted over food and fuel shortages in the country.

268.title: US sanctions 5 North Korean firms over recent ballistic missile tests
268.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on five North Korean entities for supporting "North Korea's development of weapons of mass destruction and ballistic missile programmes". The move follows recent missile tests by North Korea, including its first intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) launch since 2017. "These...tests are brazen violations of multiple UN Security Council resolutions," the US said.

269.title: We expect good news over the weekend on Mariupol evacuations: Ukraine
269.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych on Saturday said the government expects good news over the weekend regarding evacuation of the inhabitants of the besieged city of Mariupol. "Our delegation has reached an agreement in Istanbul (during Ukraine-Russia peace talks) to provide evacuations," Arestovych added. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 31.

270.title: Russia registers world's first nasal COVID-19 vaccine
270.article_body: Russian Health Ministry on Friday registered world's first nasal version of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine. Gamaleya Research Centre Director Alexander Gintsburg said the vaccine will be available within three to four months. He added that the vaccine will be efficient against Omicron variant. Meanwhile, Russia reported 17,949 new cases and 340 deaths in the last 24 hours.

271.title: India beat Wales 5-1 in their opening game of women's junior hockey WC
271.article_body: India started their FIH Hockey Women's Junior World Cup campaign with a win over Wales by 5-1 in Potchefstroom, South Africa on Saturday. The scorers for India in the Group D clash were Lalremsiami, Lalrindiki, Deepika and Mumtaz Khan. Indian captain and midfielder Salima Tete was adjudged the player of the match.

272.title: There are some nerves ahead of Women's World Cup final: Meg Lanning
272.article_body: Australia captain Meg Lanning feels that there are "some nerves" in her team's camp ahead of their ICC Women's World Cup final against England on Sunday. “There are certainly some nerves around I think it would be crazy if you weren’t nervous heading into a WC final, so it’s a good thing. But there’s a lot of excitement," Lanning said.

273.title: UN climate science panel to focus on cutting greenhouse gas emissions
273.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday said its final report will focus on ways of curbing greenhouse gas emissions. While report is published, it will only be released after 195 governments will ratify the its findings as well as its summary. Experts warned this consensual nature of the report could diverge from the most dramatic warnings.

274.title: Planning for security for Amarnath Yatra done: J&K Police DGP
274.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police Dilbag Singh said on Saturday that planning for preparations and security for Amarnath Yatra is done. "An analysis of number of devotees coming this year for the yatra has been done too," he added. The pilgrimage to the Himalayan shrine of Amarnath will begin on June 30 and will end on August 11.

275.title: Big achievement: KKR's Russell on his eight-sixes vs PBKS
275.article_body: Describing his eight-sixes during his unbeaten knock of 70 off 31 balls in KKR's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022 as "big achievement", KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said it's good for him. "I'm looking to do much better. In past games I have [hit] 14 sixes...I'm happy to close off the innings as well," he added.

276.title: Ukraine's economy could contract 40% in 2022: Economy Ministry
276.article_body: The Ukrainian economy could shrink by 40% in 2022 due to the Russian invasion of the country, Ukraine's Ministry of Economy said in a statement on Saturday. "Areas in which remote work is impossible have suffered the most," it added. The economy contracted 16% year-on-year in the first quarter of this year, according to the ministry.

277.title: Bengaluru CCB arrests 2 men, seizes lethal weapons from them
277.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has apprehended a man and his accomplice within the Vyalikaval Police Station limits, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) said in a tweet on Saturday. According to information, the crime branch has also seized lethal weapons from the possession of the arrested persons.

278.title: PM Modi holds talks with Nepal PM, discusses 'blueprint of future'
278.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday met his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba at Hyderabad House in New Delhi. "We...reviewed the progress of various projects and also discussed the blueprint of the future," PM Modi said. In the meeting, both the PMs jointly inaugurated a cross-border rail network between Jaynagar in Bihar and Nepal's Kurtha and signed four Memorandums of Understanding.

279.title: 12 killed in blasts at playground in Afghanistan's Herat
279.article_body: At least 12 people were killed and 25 others were injured in two bomb blasts at a playground in Afghanistan's Herat, according to reports. The number of children killed or injured in the blasts was not mentioned in the latest reports. A local Taliban official claimed that the bombs must have been planted at the ground recently.

280.title: Jos Buttler becomes first batter to slam a hundred in IPL 2022
280.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has become the first batter to smash a hundred in IPL 2022. The 31-year-old, who is playing in his 300th T20 match, reached the three-figure mark against Mumbai Indians (MI) off 66 deliveries. It is Buttler's second hundred in IPL, with this first coming against SRH in IPL 2021.

281.title: I'll keep acting till I die: Sanjay on shooting film post cancer treatment
281.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt opened up about his experience of shooting for film post his cancer treatment. "I'm an artist and till the day I die, I'll keep acting if God permits me to," he said. The actor further said that he feels proud to be a part of the industry. Sanjay Dutt will be next seen in 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

282.title: Saisha Shinde apologises to Kangana after eviction from 'Lock Upp'
282.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde took to Instagram to share a series of pictures of actress Kangana Ranaut in her outfits to apologise to her. This comes after she was eliminated from Kangana's reality show 'Lock Upp' following an argument between the two. "I ended up disrespecting you...I'm sorry [because] all I wanted was to be a version of you," Saisha wrote.

283.title: India were a long way out, Gary told me 'Dhoni will fetch the WC': Upton
283.article_body: Discussing MS Dhoni's promotion up the order in the 2011 World Cup final, ex-India mental conditioning coach Paddy Upton said India were still a "long way out" from winning the World Cup when Dhoni walked out. "I remember turning to India's head coach Gary Kirsten who said 'MS is going out there to fetch us the trophy'," added Upton.

284.title: US Senator probes hackers' forged legal requests to Apple, Meta
284.article_body: US Senator Ron Wyden has requested information from technology firms and government agencies about the recent forged legal requests by hackers to firms including Meta and Apple. Wyden called reports of the forged requests an "enormous threat to Americans' safety and national security". He also raised concerns that the requests could be coming from "compromised foreign law enforcement agencies".

285.title: Girl apologises to inquiry panel after row over offering namaz in MP classroom
285.article_body: Days after a girl wearing hijab was purportedly seen offering namaz inside a classroom of Madhya Pradesh's Dr Harisingh Gour University, the student has tendered a written apology to an inquiry committee established by the university to probe the matter. The girl claimed that she offered namaz in the classroom unintentionally as she was getting late in reaching the hostel.

286.title: It's a story close to my heart: Shakun on series on Osho, Ma Anand Sheela
286.article_body: Filmmaker Shakun Batra, who had announced a series on the life of spiritual leader Osho or Bhagwan Rajneesh and his secretary Ma Anand Sheela, has shared an update on the project. "It's a story very close to my heart...It's something I do want to venture back to...I don't know the timing of it...But it remains close to me," he said.

287.title: Shah Rukh Khan is responsible for where I am today: John Abraham
287.article_body: Actor John Abraham, while talking about his 'Pathaan' co-star Shah Rukh Khan, said the latter is responsible for where he has reached in life. "Shah Rukh Khan is...responsible for where I am because when I started modelling he was the judge in the show," John said. John further added that he has a lot of respect for the actor.

288.title: If RR put up a big score, MI may find it difficult to chase: Azharuddin
288.article_body: After MI won the toss against RR in IPL 2022 and chose to bowl first, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said if RR put up a big target then MI may find it difficult to chase. He added that RR have a strong bowling line-up with "quality" spinners like Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. RR won their opener by 61 runs.

289.title: The Undertaker breaks down in ring during WWE Hall of Fame event, pics surface
289.article_body: The Undertaker, who had announced his retirement from WWE in 2020, broke down inside the ring during WWE Hall of Fame event. The Undertaker received standing ovation as he was inducted into the Hall of Fame. Following his speech, The Undertaker also wore his iconic coat and hat and said, "Never say never," seemingly teasing a return to the ring.

290.title: 7 dead, 14 injured as truck falls into valley in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur
290.article_body: As many as seven people died and 14 were injured after a truck they were travelling in fell into a valley in a village in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur on Saturday. The truck's driver, while negotiating a curve, lost control of the vehicle leading to the accident, police said. The victims were on their way to a temple, police added.

291.title: Maharashtra Home Minister orders probe into death of NCB's witness
291.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Saturday ordered police to investigate the death of Prabhakar Sail, an NCB witness in the cruise drugs case linked to Aryan Khan. "How could such a strong and healthy man die suddenly?" he asked. Sail died of a heart attack at his Chembur home and his family members don't suspect foul play.

292.title: 15-yr-old rape survivor tied to a pole & beaten by accused & his family in Odisha
292.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her 20-year-old neighbour was tied to a pole and beaten by the accused and his family members for filing a police complaint in Odisha's Nayagarh, police said. The incident took place when the girl's father went to file the complaint. The accused and seven others, including five women, have been arrested.

293.title: Properties of 5 persons accused of planning blasts in Jaipur demolished in MP
293.article_body: The district administration in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam demolished properties belonging to five of the six persons accused of planning bomb blasts in Jaipur. The accused were recently arrested in Ratlam and Rajasthan's Chittorgarh. "Illegal encroachments by these offenders were demolished. The action will continue against several other sympathisers as well," Ratlam Collector Kumar Purushottam said.

294.title: Pak PM says 'mai', 'mujhe', 'mera' 213 times in address to nation; video viral
294.article_body:
Amid political crisis, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan addressed the nation on Thursday night. 
Sharing a montage of his 45-minute speech, journalist Hamid Mir counted every time Khan said the words 'mai', 'mujhe' and 'mera'. Later, Geo News reported that he mentioned himself 213 times in total. The clip went viral with people calling Khan a "narcissist".

295.title: Natascha Sharma announces pregnancy, shares pics with baby bump
295.article_body: Television actress Natascha Sharma, known for portraying Sia in 'Na Aana Iss Des Laado', took to Instagram to announce her pregnancy and uploaded a series of pictures showing her baby bump. She captioned one of the pictures, "It's time to embrace motherhood." The pictures from Natascha's maternity photoshoot were clicked by her husband actor Aditya Redij.

296.title: Shahid Kapoor buys Mercedes-Maybach worth ₹3cr, shares video
296.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor on Saturday took to Instagram to share a video of his new Mercedes-Maybach S580 worth ₹3 crore. He captioned his post, "Falling bach." The actor had bought the car on the occasion of his 41st birthday. This is not his first Mercedes-Benz S-Class as Shahid has earlier been spotted driving a Mercedes-Benz S400 (previous-generation S-Class).

297.title: Petrol to cost ₹275/litre by next elections: Akhilesh on 'math of BJP inflation'
297.article_body: Samajwadi Party supremo Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre for increasing the fuel prices for the tenth time in 12 days and explained the "math of BJP inflation". "People are saying that at the (monthly) rate of... ₹24, if petrol prices keep increasing, then by the time the next elections are held in November-December... (petrol) will cost ₹275/litre," Yadav tweeted.

298.title: China to back military-ruled Myanmar 'no matter how situation changes'
298.article_body: China has said that it will back military-ruled Myanmar "no matter how the situation changes". China "has always placed Myanmar in an important position in its neighbourly diplomacy" and wants to "deepen exchanges and cooperation", Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told his Myanmar counterpart Wunna Maung Lwin on Friday. The Myanmar military overthrew the civilian government in February 2021.

299.title: First audio recordings on Mars reveal 2 speeds of sound; NASA shares clip
299.article_body: The first study of recordings from NASA's Perseverance Mars Rover has shown that the speed of sound is slower on Mars than on Earth, NASA said. It also revealed that sound travels at different speeds for low-pitched and high-pitched noises. "The two sound speeds are an effect of the thin CO2 atmosphere," NASA tweeted, sharing the audio clip.

300.title: Rahul Gandhi visits Puneeth Rajkumar's family in Bengaluru, shares pics
300.article_body:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's house in Bengaluru 
on Thursday and met his family members. Sharing pictures with the late actor's wife and daughter, Rahul tweeted, "Puneeth left unforgettable memories for all Kannadigas at a young age." Notably, the Kannada actor passed away at the age of 46 due to a heart attack in October 2021.

301.title: Things changed for me after my National Award win: Divya Dutta
301.article_body: Actress Divya Dutta opened up about being made the face of the films, saying, "It changed after the National Award I think. People thought I got my due." "It feels nice when...makers say 'not without you for the promotions Divya'," she added. She further said that her image has also undergone a makeover, with everyone taking her seriously.

302.title: Video shows man walking dog from 3rd floor after lockdown in Shanghai
302.article_body: Amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in Shanghai and a subsequent lockdown due to it, a video has surfaced online which showed a man lowering his dog from his third-floor window on a long leash. The clip showed the man walking his dog using the extended leash and lifting the animal back in the same way.

303.title: Bulgaria expels Russian diplomat over spying
303.article_body: Bulgaria has expelled a Russian diplomat over "unregulated intelligence activities". Bulgarian Foreign Ministry on Friday declared the diplomat "persona non grata" and gave him 72 hours to leave the country. The diplomat couldn't be charged in Bulgaria because of his diplomatic immunity. Last month, Bulgaria had expelled 12 Russian diplomats and called back its envoy from Moscow for consultations.

304.title: Escort forces 16-yr-old UK girl to have sex with 17 men in a day to repay debt
304.article_body: A 23-year-old escort has received a suspended sentence in the UK after she made a 16-year-old girl have sex with 17 men in one day to make her repay a loan she took from the escort. The victim was made to have sex with more than 30 men over two weeks for £80 per half-hour, a court was informed.

305.title: 1000 govt staff in MP's Bhopal get show-cause notices for having more than 2 kids
305.article_body: Show-cause notices have been issued to 1,000 government employees and teachers in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, seeking an answer for having more than two children, said AK Modgil, District Education Officer of Vidisha. Modgil said the state government in 2000 specified if any employee had a third child born after January 26, 2001, then they wouldn't be eligible for the job.

306.title: CM Bommai announces ₹5 crore for Karnataka's police welfare fund
306.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced a ₹5 crore grant for the police welfare fund on Saturday. CM Bommai added that the state government is "proud" of the force, which is known for its “conscience, impartiality and humanitarian qualities”. "Crime can be controlled if the police function without any compromise with...criminals," he said while participating in Police Flag Day celebrations.

307.title: Patient bitten by rats in ICU of Telangana govt hospital dies
307.article_body: A 38-year-old man, Srinivas, who was allegedly bitten by rats in the ICU of Warangal's MGM Hospital, died at Hyderabad's NIMS. An official claimed he didn't die of rat bite but from other complications. Srinivas's brother said the incident happened on March 30 and it left him bleeding. Action was initiated against four hospital employees and an inquiry was ordered.

308.title: No unrest in MVA govt, focussed on development: Uddhav Thackeray
308.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has claimed that there is "no internal unrest in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government" on Saturday. "This is MVA, which has its feet firmly on the ground and is working for the state’s development," Thackeray said. He added that the state's coalition government has responded to its critics through its commitment to work for Maharashtra.

309.title: ED attaches assets worth over ₹4 crore of Bihar 'land mafia'
309.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached assets worth ₹4.04 crore of a Bihar-based 'land mafia' under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The accused and his brothers are engaged in extortion and other criminal activities, ED said. "They are accused in many FIRs...charge-sheets have been filed against them on charges of murder, attempt to murder etc," ED further said.

310.title: Awareness needed, not force: Mandaviya on Population Control Bill
310.article_body: Rejecting the need of population control bill in India, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that government had successfully used awareness and health campaigns to reduce population growth rather than using "force". The bill which was bought by BJP MP Rakesh Sinha in July 2019 was withdrawn by him on Friday.  The Bill sought to enforce a two-child rule in India.

311.title: NASA conducts last major test before Moon mission launch
311.article_body: NASA has started conducting the "last major test" before the launch of its upcoming Moon mission. It's having a "wet dress rehearsal" for its Space Launch System rocket. It's designed to launch NASA's new crew capsule called Orion, which will carry future astronauts to Moon. It'll launch Orion, without any crew inside, on a four-to six-week-long mission around the Moon.

312.title: Forest official cycles 294 km from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge
312.article_body: Nanasaheb Ladkat, a 59-year-old forest officer in Maharashtra, cycled from Pune to Kolhapur to take charge at his new posting as field director and conservator of Sahyadri Tiger Reserve. Ladkat reportedly cycled 294 kilometres in 17 hours, of which 12 hours were spent pedalling. "The purpose behind this cycling endeavour was to give a message of saving forests," Ladkat said.

313.title: Railway Division in Pune earns record revenue from auto transport
313.article_body: The Railway Division in Pune earned record ₹54.51 crore by transporting vehicles from various automobile manufacturers in the district in the previous financial year. This is a 143% hike in revenues earned from the segment in comparison to the year before last, according to a report. The division had run 301 freight trains last year to transport the vehicles.

314.title: Over 10 illegal farmhouses along Yamuna floodplains demolished
314.article_body: Noida Authority on Friday demolished more than 10 farmhouses along the Yamuna floodplains in Sectors 134 and 135 that had been built illegally. "A drive was carried out to demolish the illegal structures. As per the rules, in floodplain areas, permanent structures cannot be maintained," an official said. The structures were spread across an area of over 25,000 square metres.

315.title: Kejriwal, Mann spin charkha at Guj's Sabarmati Ashram; video surfaces
315.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party has shared a video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann spinning the charkha at the Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat's Ahmedabad during their visit on Saturday on Twitter. Mahatma Gandhi had stayed in the Ashram. "We consider ourselves blessed that we were born in Gandhiji's country...There is a feeling of peace here," Kejriwal said.

316.title: Tamannaah celebrates Gudi Padwa on sets of 'Babli Bouncer', shares pics
316.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia celebrated Gudi Padwa on the sets of her upcoming film, 'Babli Bouncer'. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories on Saturday, shared a few pictures where she can be seen posing with the film's director Madhur Bhandarkar and actors Saurabh Shukla and Supriya Shukla. "Thank you Madhur sir for always adding festivities to our work days," Tamannaah wrote.

317.title: Bungalow of Hanuman set on fire: Tejashwi on Chirag's eviction from Janpath residence
317.article_body: Days after LJP leader Chirag Paswan was evicted from 12 Janpath bungalow which was allotted to Ram Vilas Paswan in New Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said that BJP has set fire to the bungalow of 'Hanuman'. "Ram Vilas Paswan was standing with the BJP till the last. This is the consequence of supporting the BJP," he added.

318.title: Andhra CM flags off 500 AC vans to transport pregnant women to hospitals
318.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday flagged off 500 air-conditioned (AC) vans, named Dr YSR Thalli Bidda Express, to transport pregnant women to hospitals for delivery for free. The vans will also drop the mother and newborn back home once they are discharged from the hospital. "108 ambulance services...104 healthcare services have also been revamped," Reddy said.

319.title: Maybe Umesh's hurt after being picked late having gone unsold twice: Kaif
319.article_body: Talking about Umesh Yadav who is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, Mohammad Kaif said Umesh may have felt hurt after being picked late in the mega auction, having gone unsold in the first two rounds. "Umesh may have felt that in the future no IPL team [will] go for him and that's...what may have motivated him," added Kaif.

320.title: Rohit batting with new approach since India's T20 WC loss vs NZ: Parthiv
320.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India captain Rohit Sharma has been batting with a new approach having adopted the role of an enforcer, since Team India's defeats against Pakistan and New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2021. "Rohit can accelerate really well but if he starts with an aggressive intent as well, the bowlers are taken aback," added Parthiv.

321.title: He said 'I took a punch from Muhammad Ali': Oscars Producer on Chris' reaction
321.article_body: Academy Awards Producer Will Packer has revealed what happened backstage after Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock. Packer recalled, "I said, 'Did he really hit you?' And he looked at me and he goes, 'I just took a punch from Muhammad Ali'...He was immediately in joke mode, but you could tell that he was very much still in shock."

322.title: China separates COVID-19 positive children from their parents in Shanghai
322.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai are separating COVID-19 infected children from their parents and sending them to quarantine centres, amid the city's largest outbreak. One such parent said doctors threatened to leave her infected two-and-a-half-year-old daughter at the hospital if the child wasn't sent to quarantine. Pictures of crying children at a Shanghai health facility went viral in China.

323.title: Who were India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad members and how did they perform?
323.article_body: India's 2011 World Cup-winning squad was led by MS Dhoni, who scored 241 runs in the tournament. Sachin Tendulkar, featuring in his last World Cup, was India's highest run-scorer with 482 runs. Zaheer Khan was India's highest wicket-taker in the tournament with 21 wickets. Yuvraj Singh, who was Player of the Tournament, scored 362 runs and took 15 wickets.

324.title: For ₹1,400 crore, Amazon destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company: Future Retail
324.article_body: Future Retail told the Supreme Court that "for ₹1,400 crore, Amazon has destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company". Future's lawyer was referring to the ₹1,400 crore deal between Amazon and Future Coupons, which Amazon has cited to block the deal between Future and Reliance Retail. "We are hanging by a thread...No one wants to do business with us now," Future's lawyer said.

325.title: Criminal probe ordered after UK ferry firm fired 786 employees on Zoom call
325.article_body: UK's P&O Ferries is under criminal and civil investigation after it fired 786 employees over a Zoom call without notice and replaced them with lower-paid crew. The company's CEO Peter Hebblethwaite "stood before MPs and admitted to breaking the law and his actions must now be scrutinised", UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said. Hebblethwaite said unions weren't consulted before layoffs.

326.title: BSF seizes 210 cough syrup bottles from Indo-B'desh border in Meghalaya
326.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) troops have seized 210 bottles of Phensedyl syrup from India-Bangladesh border in Meghalaya's South Garo hills. According to a statement, the bottles were being smuggled to Bangladesh, where the codeine-based cough syrup is banned. This year, BSF seized over 1,300 bottles of Phensedyl while they were being sent illegally through the international border in Meghalaya.

327.title: TV actors Dheeraj Dhoopar, Vinny Arora expecting their 1st child; share pic
327.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' actor Dheeraj Dhoopar and his wife, actress Vinny Arora took to social media to announce that they are expecting their first child. "We're expecting, a tiny miracle August 2022," they wrote in the caption. Several actors, including Kishwer Merchantt, Suyyash Rai and Avika Gor congratulated them in the comments section.

328.title: Congratulations, all the best: PM Modi to Aus ahead of Women's WC final
328.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has extended good wishes and congratulated Australia as they will be playing in Women's World Cup final against defending champions England on Sunday. Notably, six-time champions Australia are on an 11-match unbeaten streak. England and Australia will meet in a World Cup final for first time in 34 years. Match will be played at Hagley Oval, Christchurch.

329.title: Indian startup Pixxel launches its first satellite to space with Musk's SpaceX
329.article_body: Indian space tech startup Pixxel has launched its first satellite to space aboard billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Transporter-4 mission from Cape Canaveral, US. Called 'Shakuntala', it is the startup's first fully-fledged satellite and hosts one of the highest resolution hyperspectral commercial cameras ever flown to space, Pixxel said. The startup is aiming to build a health monitor for Earth.

330.title: SRK is an amazing actor, he's very passionate about his work: Bobby
330.article_body: Bobby Deol in an interview praised Shah Rukh Khan and his skills as a producer. He said that Shah Rukh is an amazing actor and very passionate about his work. "That's why he started his production house and...I'm so thankful for Red Chillies because they gave me 'Class of 83'...and that was the beginning of my OTT journey," said Bobby.

331.title: Miley Cyrus tests positive for COVID-19, says 'It was worth it'
331.article_body: Singer-actor Miley Cyrus, who was recently on a world tour, has tested positive for COVID-19. "Traveling around the world...meeting hundreds of fans a day...chances of getting Covid are pretty high. I have Covid now but it was definitely worth it," she wrote on Twitter. However, the singer added that she will not be performing at the upcoming Janie's Fund event.

332.title: Aaditya Thackeray inaugurates 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune
332.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday inaugurated the 'Alternate Fuel Conclave' in Pune. The conclave, which aims to promote clean mobility, will have an electric vehicle (EV) exhibition and an EV rally on April 3. Many companies, including Tata Motors, are participating in the exhibition to showcase their two-wheelers and cars from the alternate fuel segment.

333.title: Rashmika Mandanna to play female lead in Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Animal'
333.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna is set to play the female lead in Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Animal'. The makers of the film announced the decision on the occasion of Ugadi and Gudi Padwa on Saturday. Helmed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, the film will go on floors this summer. 'Animal' will also star Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol in key roles.

334.title: Don't lie, it's not: Arshad after reporter calls Bachchhan Paandey a 'success'
334.article_body: In a recent media interaction, actor Arshad Warsi spoke about the box office performance of his recently released film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. When a reporter called the film's performance at the box office "a success", Arshad chuckled and said, "Don't lie, it's not a success." Arshad added that it was a good film and it just went through a bad patch.

335.title: Thanks but we'll pass: Russia as Czech govt asks Russian diplomats to quit
335.article_body: Czech Republic's Foreign Ministry appealed to Russian diplomats to quit over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine to avoid being accomplices to the "apocalyptic destruction of its sovereign neighbour". Reacting to it, the Russian Mission in Geneva said, "Thanks for the 'generous offer'...but we'll pass. We've plenty of conscience and already maintain the capacity to recognize US lapdog when we see one."

336.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4 cr of Punjab ex-SSP in money laundering case
336.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached assets worth ₹4.07 crore of Punjab Police's former Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Surjit Singh Grewal in a money laundering case. He had allegedly incurred excess expenditure above his known lawful sources of income. Grewal had purchased various immovable and movable properties in his and his family members' name, as per ED.

337.title: Forest officials rescue 3 kangaroos in West Bengal; team formed to investigate
337.article_body: Forest officials have rescued three kangaroos in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri. According to officials, at least two of the kangaroos were found with some critical injuries on their bodies and were sent to Bengal Safari park for treatment. "A team has been formed to investigate the matter," said Sanjay Dutta, the Belacoba forest range officer.

338.title: Meat shops ordered to remain shut during Navratri in Ghaziabad
338.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has directed all meat shops to remain shut from April 2-10 in view of Navratri. "It has been directed that cleanliness be maintained in respective zones, in temples, and to ensure meat shops remain closed," the order issued for five zones read. Mayor Asha Sharma said the ban on selling raw meat is enforced only during Navratri.

339.title: I've reached a stage where negativity motivates me: Shehnaaz Gill
339.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview has stated that she has reached a stage where even negativity motivates her to do better. "I believe in doing right, not hurting anyone and concentrating...on improving myself. Maybe that's what will determine my success in life," the actress added. She was earlier trolled for smiling after her boyfriend actor Sidharth Shukla's demise.

340.title: Kim Kardashian to rebrand 'KKW Fragrance' amid divorce with Kanye West
340.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian announced on Friday that she will be rebranding her 'KKW Fragrance' line. Kim took to her Instagram Stories to inform that the KKW Fragrance website will shut down on May 1 to 'relaunch in the future under a brand new name'. This comes after Kim was declared legally single by a US court.

341.title: 1st time feels like Northeast is part of India's mainstream: Rijiju
341.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju while addressing a conference over the reduction of areas under AFSPA in Manipur, Nagaland and Assam on Saturday, said that for the "first time" it feels like the Northeast is part of India's "mainstream". He also called the decision to withdraw AFSPA "revolutionary", and added that it means that "peace has returned to that area".

342.title: MI to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
342.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 match.  MI are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their defeat against DC. RR have made one change to their playing XI, with Navdeep Saini replacing Nathan Coulter-Nile. RR had won their opening match of IPL 2022 against SRH.

343.title: Nigerian held in Noida for cheating women through matrimony sites
343.article_body: A Nigerian national was arrested in UP's Noida for allegedly cheating women by contacting them through matrimonial sites using fake identities, police said. The accused who came to India on medical visa, has so far, as per Cyber Cell estimates, duped his victims of at least ₹50 crore. The police have also traced a farmhouse he has purchased near Pune.

344.title: Will fulfil commitments on crypto, bank privatisation: FM Sitharaman
344.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government will fulfil commitments on issues like bank privatisation and cryptocurrency regulation. Speaking at the CNBC-TV18 India Business Leader Awards event, she added, "These are commitments which we have to fulfil. We will be moving forward, you will get to know when."

345.title: 26-yr-old woman returning from work gang-raped in park by 2 men in Delhi
345.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped and thrashed by two men while she was returning from work in Delhi on Tuesday night. The accused initially raped her inside a park and then took her to rented accommodation and perpetrated the crime again, a report stated. Following a complaint, Delhi Police arrested both the accused on charges of abduction and rape.

346.title: Next pandemic could be caused by insect-borne viruses like Zika, dengue: WHO
346.article_body: The next pandemic could be triggered by insect-borne viruses like Zika and dengue, an official of the World Health Organization (WHO) has warned. "We...have some signals that the risk is increasing," said Dr Sylvie Briand, Director of WHO's Global Infectious Hazard Preparedness team. Stressing on preparing for the potential pandemic, the agency said that international action is essential.

347.title: Delhi govt allows private shops to offer discounts up to 25% on liquor MRP
347.article_body: Delhi's Department of Excise has issued an order allowing the private shops in the city to offer discounts up to 25% on MRP of liquor. "However, in overall public interest...government reserves the right to withdraw the discount at any time," the order reads. Earlier, in February, the Delhi government had prohibited discounts and schemes being offered by liquor stores.

348.title: PBKS showed real fight to reduce KKR to 51/4 after scoring 137: Mayank
348.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said his team's bowlers showed "real fight" to reduce KKR to 51/4, while defending 138 in their IPL 2022 match. Andre Russell, Sam Billings stitched an unbeaten partnership of 90 runs off 47 balls as KKR won by six wickets. Russell scored 70 runs off 31 balls with the knock comprising two fours, eight sixes.

349.title: Don't just think of scoring 200, need to respect the pitch: Kaif on PBKS
349.article_body: Reacting to PBKS being bowled out for 137 in their IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said PBKS need to respect the pitch rather than just thinking of scoring 200 every time. "The fact that Bhanuka Rajapaksa would hit three sixes off three balls and would be so explosive is something...I didn't quite read," added Kaif.

350.title: Experience of winning 2017 Women's World Cup can help us: England captain
