350.article_body: England skipper Heather Knight said the team's experience of winning ICC Women's World Cup in 2017 can help her side win the 2022 Women's World Cup final against Australia on Sunday. "It (winning 2017 World Cup) will be really useful for us...knowing that we can deal with that pressure when games are close and things are at stake," said Knight.

351.title: Mumbai taxi driver cheated of ₹38 lakh he arranged by selling brother's home
351.article_body: A taxi driver from Kurla, Irshad Shaikh, was allegedly cheated of ₹38 lakh by a woman, Komal Paranjpe, and her accomplice, Anil Vishnu Sawant. Sawant claimed he needed money to transfer a wine shop licence to his name and assured Shaikh he'd give him ₹50 lakh for the help. Shaikh sold his brother's house and mortgaged ornaments to arrange money.

352.title: JP Morgan drops Apple, Qualcomm from most preferred stocks list
352.article_body: Analysts at JP Morgan have dropped Apple and chipmaker Qualcomm from its list of most preferred stocks over slowing smartphones demand. The firm still rates Apple and Qualcomm "overweight", the equivalent of a "buy" rating. It was earlier reported that Apple is planning to cut the production of iPhone and AirPod due to a demand slowdown.

353.title: New variant of COVID-19 found in UK, WHO issues warning
353.article_body: A new COVID-19 variant has been found in the UK, with the country's Health Security Agency saying it was studying 'XE' - a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, referred to as a "recombinant". The WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of Omicron, that may be more transmissible than any strain of COVID-19.

354.title: I feared for my life a couple of times while batting with Russell: KKR's Sam Billings
354.article_body: Talking about Andre Russell's match-winning knock of 70*(31) against PBKS, KKR's Sam Billings said, "I had the best seat in the house and, what a performance by the big man." He added, "I was very lucky to be standing where I stood. I feared for my life a couple of times, as we saw, but special, special [knock] for him."

355.title: Video shows 2 drunk men dancing on car roof in Ghaziabad, car owner fined ₹20,000
355.article_body: Ghaziabad Police has fined a car owner ₹20,000 after a video showed two men, who were allegedly drunk, dancing on its roof. "A group of boys, visibly drunk, dancing on the roof of their car on the Delhi-Meerut expressway," a Twitter user wrote. The video shows one of them recording a video of the two men dancing on the roof.

356.title: Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight develops technical snag while taking off, grounded
356.article_body: A Kolkata-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at Ranchi Airport in Jharkhand on Saturday after it developed a technical snag while taking off, officials said. "The air-conditioner of the plane developed a snag and it stopped working," said Vinod Sharma, the airport's director. According to him, alternative arrangements were made for the passengers and the flight was brought back to bay.

357.title: Serbian President waves at imaginary crowd at an event, video surfaces
357.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic waving at an imaginary crowd along with Hungarian PM Viktor Orban after Vucic inaugurated a section of a railway line. The clip showed Vucic waving at the railway platform, which had no crowd, while Orban is seated next to him. Orban, however, stopped waving after a point.

358.title: Future Enterprises misses due date to repay ₹2,835 crore to lenders
358.article_body: Future Enterprises has informed the stock exchanges that it has missed the due date of March 31, 2022, to repay ₹2,835.65 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. On Friday, Future Retail (FRL) said it had defaulted on a loan repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore and also failed to raise ₹3,900 crore. FRL cited ongoing litigations with Amazon as the reason.

359.title: US commits $300 million more in security aid to Ukraine
359.article_body: The US has said it will provide an additional $300 million in security assistance to bolster Ukraine's capacity to defend itself. The package includes laser-guided rocket systems, tactical drones, Humvees, night vision goggles, machine guns, and medical supplies. "The US has now committed...over $1.6 billion in security assistance since Russia's unprovoked, premeditated invasion," Pentagon said.

360.title: Heat wave warning issued for 10 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
360.article_body: The IMD issued heat wave warning for 10 states/UTs over five days. Heat wave conditions are likely to prevail over Haryana and Chhattisgarh on April 2. They are likely to prevail over Himachal Pradesh, Jammu, Maharashtra and Gujarat on April 2 and 3. Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh & Madhya Pradesh may witness heat wave conditions during next five days.

361.title: PM 'robbing' Punjab of its rights: CM Bhagwant Mann
361.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accused PM Narendra Modi of "robbing" the state of its rights amid a political row over Home Minister Amit Shah's recent announcement that central service rules will apply to employees of Chandigarh. "The PM says 'sabka saath sabka vikas'. Where is our 'saath'? Neither you take our 'saath' nor give the same to us," Mann said.

362.title: Australia trade pact is India's 1st agreement with a developed country after 10 yrs
362.article_body: After India signed an economic cooperation and trade agreement with Australia, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal referred to it as a "historic day" for India. "It is the first agreement with a developed country after a decade," Goyal said. The agreement will take bilateral trade from the existing $27.5 billion to $45-50 billion in over five years, the minister added.

363.title: Which sectors will benefit from India's historic trade pact with Australia?
363.article_body: Several labour-intensive sectors will get duty-free access to markets in Australia under the historic economic cooperation and trade agreement signed by India and Australia. These include textiles and apparel, leather and footwear, select agricultural and fish products, gems and jewellery, pharma and machinery and electrical goods sectors. Overall, 96% of Indian goods will get duty-free access.

364.title: 25 Rohingyas owing allegiance to Tablighi Jamaat detained in J&K
364.article_body: At least 25 Rohingya men who owe allegiance to the Tablighi Jamaat have been detained by the police in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, officials said. The Rohingyas were later shifted to a holding centre inside a jail in Hiranagar on Friday, the officials added. The men had been picked up from two mosques in Ramban on March 30, police said.

365.title: Open borders between India, Nepal should not be misused: PM Modi
365.article_body: The open borders between India and Nepal should not be misused, PM Narendra Modi said on Saturday at an event in Delhi. Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, who is on a visit to India, was also present at the event. "We also stressed on maintaining close cooperation between our defence and security agencies," PM Modi added.

366.title: BharatPe board aiming for IPO in 18-24 months: Chairman
366.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said the firm's board, founders and management want to take it public in the next 18-24 months. He added the board will also be expanded with more independent directors in future. He also revealed that there have been investor queries for funding and despite the negative press, BharatPe's valuation should be higher than $2.8 billion.

367.title: Waiting to book case if you're wheeling: B'luru police as it arrests person
367.article_body: Bengaluru's DCP Traffic East on Friday tweeted that it has filed a case against a person and seized his two-wheeler for allegedly wheeling on Bettadasanapura Road in Electronic City. "If you are wheeling, we are waiting to book [a] case against you," the traffic police said. The traffic police also shared a picture of the accused and the seized vehicle.

368.title: Lady Gaga, Justin Bieber to perform at Grammys 2022
368.article_body: Lady Gaga and Justin Bieber will perform at the 64th Grammy Awards in Las Vegas on April 3. The announcement of Gaga and Bieber's performances comes after the rock band Foo Fighters cancelled their performance at the Grammys this year following the demise of their drummer Taylor Hawkins. Gaga and Bieber join a lineup that includes BTS and Billie Eilish.

369.title: Oil depot attack to further stretch Russian logistics: UK
369.article_body: The destruction of several oil tanks at a depot in Russia's Belgorod city will "likely add short-term strain to Russia's already stretched logistics chains", UK Defence Ministry said. Russia had accused Ukraine of carrying out the airstrike at the oil depot on Friday. "Supplies to Russian forces encircling [Ukraine's] Kharkiv [60 km from Belgorod] may be particularly affected," it added.

370.title: Entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl 4 overs: Shastri
370.article_body: Ravi Shastri said entire India will be happy seeing Hardik Pandya bowl four overs, adding that India will straightaway become potential T20 World Cup 2022 winners if Hardik finds his mojo. "Hardik is hungry," stated Shastri. Discussing the IPL 2022 match between MI and RR, Shastri said Jos Buttler will "hammer" the MI bowlers if he survives for six overs.

371.title: Political executive will change, you are permanent: CJI Ramana to CBI
371.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that political executive will change with time but the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), as an institution, is permanent. "Be impermeable...be independent," CJI told CBI. "There is an immediate requirement for the creation of an independent umbrella institution...to bring various agencies like CBI, SFIO, ED, etc under one roof," he stated.

372.title: Anil wishes sister-in-law & Miss India 1969 Kavita Singh on b'day, pens note
372.article_body: Anil Kapoor took to Instagram on Friday to wish his sister-in-law Kavita Singh on her 70th birthday. Kavita is Sunita Kapoor's elder sister and was crowned Miss India in 1969. Sharing some old pictures of Kavita, Anil wrote, "Happy 70th Birthday Kavita! We're all so proud of you always! Lucky to have a friend and sister in law like you."

373.title: SAI releases over ₹7 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes
373.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has released ₹7.22 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes across 21 disciplines, including para-sports, for the months of January to March. The amount includes an out-of-pocket allowance of ₹1.20 lakh for each residential athlete. The majority part of the budget is allocated for athletes' lodging, food and education at the academy, SAI said.

374.title: 40,000 tonnes of diesel from India reach Sri Lanka as it declares emergency
374.article_body: A ship carrying 40,000 tonnes of diesel under a $1-billion credit line by India has reached Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis. On Friday night, the country's government declared a state of emergency after protests over the crisis turned violent. Earlier, Indian Oil's Lankan subsidiary supplied 6,000 MT of fuel to the Ceylon Electricity Board to generate electricity.

375.title: Ukraine raises $600,000 from 'Museum of War' NFTs on Russian invasion
375.article_body: The Ukrainian government has raised more than $600,000 from its NFT collection, Meta History: Museum of War', showing a timeline of the Russian invasion. The government sold 1,282 artworks on its first day of sales, raising 190 Ether cryptocurrency tokens. The Ukrainian government has already raised about $70.2 million in crypto donations, its official website showed.

376.title: Woman techie arrested for selling cannabis to IT employees, youths in Hyd
376.article_body: A woman techie was arrested for allegedly supplying cannabis to some IT employees and youths in Hyderabad. Police said she, along with her husband and two others, were selling cannabis to customers on March 12 when police apprehended two youths with 1.2 kg cannabis. The couple, who had managed to escape, were arrested after police received information from the youths.

377.title: I suffered from sleep apnea, it got more intense with time and it is dangerous: Badshah
377.article_body: Rapper Badshah, in an episode of Shilpa Shetty's fitness chat show 'Shape of You', revealed that he suffered from sleep apnea. "It got more intense with time and it is dangerous," he added, stating that now he doesn't suffer from it. "I have been through clinical depression, I have been through severe anxiety disorder," he further said.

378.title: I don't discuss my orders: Zelenskyy on Russian allegations of fuel depot attack
378.article_body: Responding to Russian accusations that Ukraine attacked a fuel depot inside Russia's Belgorod, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "I'm sorry I don't discuss any of my orders." "There are things which I only share with military armed forces of Ukraine," Zelenskyy added. Russian Ministry of Defense stated that two Ukrainian Mi-24 helicopters carried out an airstrike on the depot.

379.title: SRH lodge protest against Kane Williamson's dismissal
379.article_body: SRH have lodged a protest with the BCCI against their captain Kane Williamson's dismissal against RR in their first IPL 2022 match, claiming that the catch was not clean. RR's Devdutt Padikkal had managed to scoop his fingers under the ball to hold onto a low catch and the third umpire had ruled that the catch was clean.

380.title: I need to work hard on my game: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav
380.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' fast bowler Umesh Yadav believes that he needs to "work hard" on his skills despite picking up four wickets against the Punjab Kings on Friday. "I need to work hard. Getting older and when you know you play just one format, I look to bowl as much as possible," Yadav said.

381.title: Lemon price rises to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat due to tight supply
381.article_body: The prices of lemons have surged to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat's Rajkot due to a shortage in supplies and a rise in demand. Earlier, the lemons were being sold at ₹50-60 per kg, as per ANI report. "This increase in price is affecting our kitchen budget. We don't know when will the prices go down," a customer told ANI.

382.title: Russian forces are noticeably moving out of northern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
382.article_body: Russian troops are "slowly but noticeably" moving out of the north of Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He urged residents to remain cautious amid troop withdrawal. Zelenskyy also warned that the situation in the country's east is "extremely difficult" with Russia gathering its forces and "preparing for new powerful blows". Ukraine is preparing an "active" defence, he added.

383.title: Exempt Ayodhya temples from water, house tax: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
383.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday asked Ayodhya Municipal Corporation to stop the collection of house and water taxes from temples, maths and dharamshalas. He instead suggested  taking 'token money' from such religious institutions. "He asked officials to prepare a plan in this regard and submit it to the urban development department," a government spokesperson added.

384.title: Too much pressure on Pollard, even the opponents know that: Shastri
384.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said there is "too much" pressure on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard in the absence of Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav. "Even the opponents know that Pollard is under pressure. His early wicket can make a difference of 20-30 runs," added Shastri. Pollard was dismissed for three in MI's IPL 2022 opener against DC.

385.title: Police seize truck carrying 197 kg of marijuana in Pune, 3 booked
385.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad police have seized 197 kilograms of marijuana from a truck in Pune and have booked three people including the driver who has been arrested. Police intercepted the truck on the Chakan–Shikrapur road and seized items worth ₹63.34 lakh, police said. The case was lodged under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

386.title: Hyd SHE Teams in-charge reviews performance for first quarter of 2022
386.article_body: AR Srinivas, Additional Commissioner of Police (Crimes), on Friday reviewed the performance of Hyderabad SHE Teams for the first quarter of the year 2022. Srinivas, who is also in-charge of SHE Teams, rewarded officials for their sustained efforts in making Hyderabad a safe city for women. He further promised to provide the teams with more advanced logistics in future.

387.title: Pune court to fine woman each time father is denied access to son
387.article_body: A family court in Pune has directed a woman to allow the father access to their 11-year-old son or she will be fined ₹5,000 for each missed access. The court said that if the woman violates the order in the next six months, the son's custody will be given to the father. The couple has been living separately since 2008.

388.title: Punjab govt is 'baccha party': Anil Vij on Punjab seeking transfer of Chandigarh
388.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana Minister Anil Vij, said, "Punjab government is 'baccha party'. They don't have complete knowledge of issues." "Chandigarh isn't the only issue but there are many other issues linked to it," he added. "They didn't speak anything about issues like SYL, Hindi speaking areas," he added.

389.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 10 accused, rejects pleas of 8 in Palghar lynching case
389.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to 10 accused and rejected the pleas of eight others in connection with 2020 Palghar mob lynching case. The applicants cannot be held guilty without any sufficient evidence, HC said. A mob lynched two sadhus and their driver in April 2020 in Maharashtra's Palghar amid rumours that thieves were roaming around during COVID-19 lockdown.

390.title: Trust yourself when no one does: Amit Mishra on Umesh holding Purple Cap
390.article_body: Reacting to Umesh Yadav being IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Trust yourself even when no one else does." Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches at an economy rate of 4.91. "Umesh played...two matches in [the] last two IPL seasons...Warms my heart to see him do well," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer.

391.title: Teacher gets 5-year jail term for sexually abusing 13-year-old boy in Mumbai
391.article_body: A 52-year-old sports teacher was convicted and sentenced to five years in jail for sexually abusing a 13-year-old boy on the pretext of giving him a medal and a certificate for participating in a competition. The boy informed a court in Mumbai that the accused pretended to show him and his friend a magic trick and then touched him inappropriately.

392.title: BMC's property tax collection increases by ₹700 crore in 2021-22
392.article_body: The property tax collected by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) increased by ₹700 crore in 2021-22 as compared to the last year. The BMC collected ₹5,792 crore from property tax in 2021-22, which is the highest in its history, officials added. According to the civic body, three out of the city's 24 wards collected 30% more tax than the previous year.

393.title: Langur cutouts to be placed in parts of UP's Meerut to scare away monkeys
393.article_body: The Forest Department in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has decided to place cutouts of langurs in some areas to scare away monkeys. "Increasing monkey presence is a concern in northern India," Meerut DFO said, adding that the move is aimed at providing relief to people. Residents had earlier reportedly appealed to the district administration to find a solution to the problem.

394.title: Biden nominates 2 Indian-Americans to key administrative positions
394.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated two Indian-Americans to key administrative positions. Vinay Singh has been nominated as Chief Financial Officer, Department of Housing and Urban Development, while Kalpana Kotagal is the nominee for Commissioner on the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. Singh had also served in the Obama-Biden administration as a Deputy Assistant Secretary (US Field).

395.title: Class 10 girl beaten for hours for filing rape complaint in Odisha
395.article_body: Eight people, including five women, have been arrested for allegedly beating a Class 10 girl for hours at a kangaroo court in Odisha's Nayagarh for filing a case accusing a 21-year-old man of raping her. The girl's family claimed that they were advised to not file a case earlier. The girl was also tied to an electric pole, police said.

396.title: My PAN card misused, small loan of ₹2,500 taken on my name: Rajkummar Rao calls out fraud
396.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao took to Twitter to call out fraud, claiming that his PAN card was misused and a small loan of ₹2,500 was taken on his name. He added that his CIBIL score has been affected due to it. He further wrote, "@CIBIL_Official, please rectify the same and do take precautionary steps against this."

397.title: Irfan Pathan pranks Suresh Raina on live TV over Preity Zinta comment
397.article_body: Irfan Pathan pranked Suresh Raina on April Fool's Day during pre-IPL match show. Irfan was talking about PBKS when Raina remarked, "Irfan...played for PBKS...for three years...Preity Zinta is their owner." Seemingly angry, Irfan said, "This isn't right...The way you brought in female angle" and left the frame. Irfan revealed it was a prank when Raina went to bring him back.

398.title: BharatPe has appointed Alvarez & Marsal exec as interim CFO: Chairman
398.article_body: BharatPe has appointed an executive from Alvarez & Marsal as its interim CFO, Chairman Rajnish Kumar said. The firm is in search of a permanent CFO and Kumar said it is in the "advanced stages" to appoint one. Kumar added that the board, founders, and management are exploring taking the firm public in the next 18-24 months.

399.title: Twitter tweets 'we're working on an edit button'; users say it's April Fools' Day
399.article_body: On April 1, Twitter tweeted on its official account that it was "working on an edit button" after which several users flagged that it was April Fools' Day. When asked if the tweet was a joke, Twitter told Reuters, "We cannot confirm or deny but we may edit our statement later." "Prove it by editing this tweet," a user wrote.

400.title: 'Stop bullying India' poster found outside US Embassy in Delhi; FIR registered
400.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against an unknown person after a poster asking US to "stop bullying India" was found stuck on a board outside the US Embassy. "Reliable [US President] Biden administration, stop bullying India. We don't need you. US needs India against China," the poster read. Police is making use of technical surveillance to trace the person.

401.title: Chandigarh is and will remain joint capital of Punjab, Haryana: CM Khattar
401.article_body: After Punjab government's resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said Chandigarh is the joint capital of the two states and will remain so. "Punjab government's one-sided resolution has no meaning," he added. "This isn't only a subject of Punjab but also of Haryana. Even the people of Himachal Pradesh claim their share," Khattar said.
